Title: TTech_Ingeniero Especialista Cloud
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: ¿QUÉ ES TELEFÓNICA CYBERSECURITY & CLOUD TECH? Somos la compañía líder en transformación digital y la cuna del talento en materia de ciberseguridad y de la nube. Trabajamos para que saques todo el partido a tu vida digital sin tener que preocuparte por nada. Nos encargamos de hacer la seguridad más humana y generar en las personas la confianza y tranquilidad que necesitan. Buscamos nuevas formas de hacer las cosas, ideas frescas e innovadoras, experimentar, divertirnos y ser entusiastas en lo que hacemos. Somos techies y queremos mejorar el mundo haciéndolo más diverso, sostenible y ciberseguro. Si tuviéramos que resumir como nos gustaría que nos definieran, no hay duda que nos gusta trabajar en equipo, remando en la misma dirección y con metas comunes, con actitud valiente y sin miedo al cambio, contando con los mejores y buscando la excelencia en lo que hacemos, abiertos y transparentes en nuestros procesos. www.telefonicatech.com ¿QUÉ HACEMOS EN EL EQUIPO? Es un rol operacional de nivel II y III que garantiza a la organización la operación eficiente de las soluciones de Cloud Computing en la organización, así como también hacia los clientes finales. Este rol especialista se centra en que las soluciones implantadas y de servicio al cliente operen de manera eficiente y continua, minimizando los impactos negativos en el negocio y favoreciendo a su desarrollo constante. ¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA? El  ingeniero especialista Cloud  hace sinergia constante con los arquitectos Cloud para validar la viabilidad de los diseños y que las soluciones a implantar sean adaptadas al catálogo de servicios y productos ofrecidos por la unidad de Cloud. El ingeniero especialista está en capacidades para ofrecer atención de Nivel II y III en horarios de 5x 8 y 7x24 (si se encuentra en guardia de emergencia). Como  Ingeniero Especialista Cloud  tus principales responsabilidades serán: Generación de la planificación del proyecto, comprometiendo los entregables y plazos de cada hito relevante del proyecto. Implementar proyectos de Cloud de diversas marcas siendo responsable ejecutar soluciones de seguridad para empresas pequeñas, media y grandes. Generar soluciones, así como ejecutar proyectos TI, planificando, realizando los Planes de Trabajo, Informe Técnicos, según métodos establecidos por la empresa. Configuración de equipos y servidores en las distintas tecnologías de gestión proyectos de data center y implementación de equipos de comunicaciones, servidores, aplicaciones WEB, entre otros, ofrecidas por Telefónica TECH. Participar de reuniones con cliente para la habilitación de los servicios.  Atender incidentes y requerimientos derivados de la mesa de control de soporte para solucionar problemas de clientes de manera eficiente y comunicativa. El cargo requiere de experiencia en redes digitales, soluciones de virtualización, Arquitectura, diseño e implementación de servicios en plataformas Cloud. El Ingeniero especialista Cloud debe tener conocimiento base de sistemas operativos y gestión avanzada por la línea de comandos. Conocimiento de soluciones y arquitectura basadas en capas distribuidas. Tener conocimiento de la suite de soluciones de cloud provider de VMware y los productos más importantes de su suite de virtualización. Tener la habilidad para gestionar proveedores de TI para el monitoreo constante de hardware e infraestructura y su correcto mantenimiento periódico. Participar y generar trainings técnicos de su especialidad para capacitar a otros integrantes de su equipo. Implementar soluciones y arquitecturas basadas en Cloud, bien sea en Infraestructura como servicio, plataforma como servicio o software como servicio. Realizar pruebas de concepto POCs alineados a las necesidades del negocio dentro del catálogo de soluciones Cloud de la empresa como en soluciones de hiperescalares del mercado. Tener conocimiento en patrones de infraestructura para aplicaciones de tipo: Legacy, monolíticas, servicios y microservicios. Tener conocimiento de soluciones de recuperación ante desastres y sus mejores prácticas. Tener conocimiento en administración de cabinas de almacenamiento y zonificación de hardware (deseable). Tener conocimientos de soluciones de contenedores y orquestación de contenedores basado en kubernetes (deseable). Conocimientos en definición de APIs e Integración de soluciones (deseables conocimientos de programación y scripting). Participar y proponer los cambios de alcances de los proyectos vía controles de cambio, verificando la efectividad de estos. Asegurar el cumplimiento de los diseños y su línea estándar definida en la implementación de proyectos y su seguimiento constante. Apoyar en los planes de mitigación, para controlar adecuadamente los plazos del Proyectos. Asegurar la Implantación de proyectos para los grandes clientes de la corporación Generar la documentación necesaria de todos los procesos técnicos de operación y mantenimiento de las aplicaciones del catálogo de servicio. El ingeniero especialista Cloud debe estar abierto a constantes transformaciones y capacitaciones de su línea base de negocio, lo que implica que debe estar en capacitación constante para colocar a la organización en posiciones competitivas para nuevos proyectos y soluciones (deseables certificaciones en Cloud VMware, AWS, Azure y otros.) Y PARA ELLO, CREEMOS QUE SERÍA IDEAL QUE CONTARAS CON… Al menos 2 años de experiencia en el mismo cargo o 5 años trabajando con: Google Cloud AWS Azure Sistemas Operativos Windows y Linux VMware con todos sus componentes Otros Virtualizadores Proyecto de migración Herramientas de migración o replicación A continuación, tienes detallado los conocimientos, herramientas y tecnologías que nos interesan: Formación Título de Ingeniero en Telecomunicación, Informática o carrera laboral equivalente.  Conocimientos técnicos Conocimiento en nubes hibridas, privadas y públicas. Conocimientos en nubes de google, amazon y Microsoft. Conocimientos en arquitecturas de comunicaciones, cliente-servidor. Conocimientos en sistemas operativos. Conocimientos en metodologías agiles. Conocimientos en buenas prácticas ITIL @cualquier versión. Además, nos gustaría que tuvieras Capacidad de análisis. Habilidades de sistemas operativos, comunicación. Proactividad e iniciativa. Responsabilidad y autoconfianza. Trabajo en equipo. Capacidad de autoaprendizaje. Nivel de inglés medio ¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS...? Formación continua para tu desarrollo profesional. Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo flexible adaptándose a tus circunstancias personales. Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales (seguro de vida, seguro médico y dental para ti y tus cargas legales, seguro catastrófico, plan telefónico, subsidio licencia menor a 10 días. Entre otros.) Excelente ambiente de trabajo dinámico y multidisciplinar.  #SomosDiversos  Estamos convencidos/as de que los equipos diversos e inclusivos son más innovadores, transformadores y consiguen mejores resultados. Por ello promovemos y garantizamos la inclusión de todas las personas sin importar género, edad, orientación e identidad sexual, cultura, discapacidad o cualquier otra condición ¡Queremos conocerte! 😊

Title: (Retail Tech) Data Engineer GCP Senior

Descripcion: Acid Labs es una firma de diseño y desarrollo de software end to end. Ejecutamos un proceso ágil estandarizado pero flexible, centrado en la calidad y la comunicación. Nos centramos en la creación de productos web y móviles increíbles, hemos estado involucrados en el desarrollo web y móvil desde 2006, convirtiéndonos en socios sólidos para nuestros clientes . Nos especializamos en crear nuevos productos a partir de un proceso UX / UI, desarrollando proyectos desde cero y también sobre proyectos ya creados, trabajando solo o como equipo para mejorias. Somos expertos en software de venta minorista, comercio electrónico a medida y empresarial, aprovechamos las configuraciones de CRM y escalamos las ventas a través del diseño y la tecnología. ¡Nos encontramos en búsqueda de Data Engineer GCP Senior! Funciones: Diseñar, desarrollar, alinear, solucionar problemas y proveer consultoría en tecnologías de software para la integración, procesamiento, almacenaje y visualización de datos, habilitando servicios automatizados basado en sólidos conocimientos de data e infraestructura en la nube, utilizando arquitectura de microservicios, continous delivery, sistemas guiados por eventos y amplio conocimiento en automatización, observabilidad, seguridad y calidad de software. -Gestiona e incorpora nuevas fuentes de datos externas a las bases de la compañía, participa en procesos de selección, extracción e identifica oportunidades de mejora en el almacenamiento y seguridad de la información. -Construye flujos de datos, combinando una variedad de tecnologías y marcos para crear la mejor solución para el negocio. -Optimiza la recuperación de datos y desarrolla cuadros de mando e informes para áreas interesadas. - Configura y pobla bases de datos analíticas, ejecuta la extracción, transformación y carga de datos (ETL) sobre grandes conjuntos de datos y crea sistemas de almacenamiento robustos para ser utilizados en informes o análisis. - Identifica y recomienda formas de mejorar la confiabilidad, eficiencia y calidad de los datos a traves de la integración de sistemas. -Prepara los datos para modelos predictivos y prescriptivos, canalizando los datos de entrada y transformarlos en una serie de fases en datos de salida. - Encuentra tendencias en conjuntos de datos y desarrolla algoritmos complejos para dar recomendaciones ante problemas de negocio. Skills: Habilidades estadísticas, analíticas, integraciones, arquitectura y bases de datos. Conocimiento avanzado de Lenguaje SQL/ NoSQL y programación. Conocimiento del negocio digital/eCommerce. Conocimientos en programación considerando uno o más lenguajes relevantes: Go, Kotlin, Python, Java y shell scripting. Experiencia trabajando con Pair Programming. Experiencia trabajando como arquitecto/desarrollador en metodologías ágiles (ej: Kanban y Scrum). conocimiento trabajando con NoSQL Databases como, Apache Cassandra, ArangoDB, Noe4J, SparkGraph, Redis, AWS DynamoDB, AWS Aurora, Azure CosmosDB, Google Big Table, Google Cloud SQL, etc. Conocimientos trabajando con motores de Analytica como Azure HD Insights, Azure Data lake, Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Apache Connect, Apache Flink, AWS EMR, AWS Kinesis, Google Dataflow, Google BigQuery. Conocimientos de UNIX/Linux, con alta experiencia trabajando con la shell, sistemas de archivos, redes y resolución de problemas en entornos productivos. ¡Los beneficios empresariales dependerán del lugar de LATAM donde te encuentres!

Title: Senior Observability Platform Developer - Python/Go
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Canonical seeks an experienced developer with a proven track record in Python and/or Go. As part of the Observability team, you will develop a cloud-native monitoring stack that composes best-in-class open-source monitoring tools. The stack is opinionated, resilient, and scalable, providing deep insights out of the box. The user experience is polished and seamless for the end-users, and its administrators will enjoy smooth, lightweight Day 1 and Day 2 operations. This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Kubernetes, and Observability. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu. The monitoring stack will monitor applications running on a mix of cloud technologies such as Kubernetes and OpenStack, as well as bare-metal, virtual machines and containers. The stack will be capable of monitoring applications and infrastructure irrespective of whether they are operated by Juju, and will leverage multiple data sources at various levels of the architecture, including Juju itself, to contextualize the collected telemetry and insights delivered to the end-users. You can read more about the project here and here. Location:  This role will be based remotely in the EMEA and Americas regions What your day will look like Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team Write, test and document high quality code to create new features Debug issues and interact with a vibrant community Review code produced by other engineers Attend conferences to represent Canonical and the Charmed Observability Stack Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events What we are looking for in you You love technology, observability and working with brilliant people You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You have a proven understanding of the importance of observability and monitoring for keeping software running smoothly You have strong working knowledge of modern monitoring technologies like Prometheus, Alertmanager, Grafana, Loki, Mimir, etc., and how they fit together You are a skilled Python developer, preferably with a track record in open source You have a working knowledge of Go You have proven, hands-on experience deploying, configuring and using Kubernetes You are comfortable contributing to open source codebases maintained by other companies, you have a history of driving consensus in groups of multiple stakeholders with different interests and getting the resulting work delivered You have experience with infrastructure-as-code and configuration management tools You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux, container images, Debian packaging, snap, distributed systems.  What we offer you Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce. In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner. Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004! Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Parental Leave Employee Assistance Programme Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints' Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events About Canonical Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business. Canonical is an equal opportunity employer We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Senior/Principal Python Developer - Remote - Latin America
Ciudad: Concepción, Bio Bio, Chile
Descripcion: FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential. We’re most proud of: Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users. Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor. Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average. The Position: We're looking to hire several Senior/Principal Python developers to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways: Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis. Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients. What We're Looking For: 5+ years of professional software development experience. 5+ years of hands-on experience building applications using Python. Solid experience working with Flask framework. Meaningful experience working with Go, Java, or Scala. Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines and experience with relevant tools. Experience with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Familiarity with relational and NoSQL databases. Advanced English is Required.  A four-year college degree is required. Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon. Forensic attention to detail. Benefits: Competitive pay in your local currency 100% remote work The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies English Classes Virtual company events each month Ample opportunity for career advancement Continuing education opportunities Depending on your location other benefits may apply FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process. Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice .

Title: Software Engineer
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Recognized as one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, Launchpad provides next-generation integration platform capabilities for connecting and managing enterprise automation and data integration. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, our operations span both North and South Americas, with a second headquarter located in Santiago, Chile. In 2021, we were recognized as the winner of the BC Tech Associations Technology Impact Awards 'Company of The Year: Growth'. We recognize the global truth that today, every company is a tech company. To succeed, every company everywhere needs their data and workflows to be integrated and automated. That understanding gave us the confidence to compete with our sector's leading providers, win top-level contracts, and build a truly world-class list of clients that includes Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more. Our vision is to bring people and technology together to work seamlessly to achieve extraordinary business outcomes and create more efficient societies. If this sounds like something you want to be part of, we’d love to hear from you. We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our team. You will be working with product managers and a distributed engineering team to design and develop a SaaS platform based on modern stacks like ReactJS, Ruby on Rails, and Python. Our SaaS Platform also includes an AI platform for NLP and Recommender systems. We are looking for someone who is capable of learning new technologies and designing a high-performance scalable platform for our customers. Responsibilities of the role: Develop scalable and performant applications leveraging a modern tech stack: Ruby/Rails, Python, ReactJS, Typescript, InertiaJS, Liquid, Mantine, HTML, CSS.  Build new features that provide B2B marketers with the ability to create and author innovative and engaging experiences for their content.  Build systems to process data to be used to drive our content experience algorithms and provide actionable insights for our clients.  Work with our Product team to scope functionality for our current and future products.  Required skills: 3-5 years with a web framework (Ruby on Rails, Django, Express.js, etc...) and/or ReactJS.  Experience with database design - MySQL preferred.  Experience with NoSQL database - MongoDB preferred.  Proficiency in JavaScript/Typescript.  Proficiency with relational databases.  Proficiency with GitHub and JIRA.  Desired skills: Experience in developing accessible applications using the accessibility standards.  Good understanding of Webpack, babel, or similar bundling tools.  Experience with building web pages using LiquidJS.  Experience writing performant ActiveRecord code.  Experience with Python.  Experience with Amazon Web Services.  Experience with Marketing Automation Platforms (Eloqua, Marketo, etc.).  Familiarity with the B2B marketing industry.  Experience with Docker and AWS ECS, AWS EKS.  Why work for Launchpad? 100% remote People first culture Excellent compensation in US Dollars Hardware setup for working from home Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia Training allowances Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc.  ...and more! At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally. Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

Title: SRE Expert
Ciudad: Las Condes, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: En Banco Scotia nos encontramos en búsqueda del próximo SRE Expert. El SRE Expert es responsable de definir la tecnología, las herramientas y las prácticas de operaciones de los activos digitales de la Banca Digital junto con Arquitectura y el Software Development Manager utilizando los conceptos de SRE conocidos globalmente. Responsabilidades    · Promueve una cultura centrada en el cliente a fin de profundizar las relaciones con los clientes y aprovechar las amplias relaciones del Banco, así como sus sistemas y conocimientos.    · Define , negocia con el/los dueños de producto y servicios, el presupuesto de error y los objetivos de disponibilidad, latencia, exactitud del dato, etc. de servicios para cada uno de los activos digitales del banco a todo nivel, con este fin debe levantar las alertas respectiva en tiempo y forma, de tal manera de tomar decisiones referentes al desarrollo y mejora de los productos bajo monitoreo.   · Diseña e implementa los indicadores basados en automatización para determinar los niveles de servicio de disponibilidad, latencia, exactitud del dato, etc. de cada uno de los servicios del banco. Para esto debe utilizar un stack actualizado que permita niveles de eficiencia muy altos en obtener y presentar la información.    · Diseña e Implementa las herramientas de monitoreo de los activos digitales para determinar incidentes de forma automática , buscando hacer cada vez más eficiente el tiempo de diagnóstico y resolución de problemas de los mismos, para esto debe estar coordinado con las áreas de Arquitectura, Product Support y Desarrollo Digital.    · Participa activamente en la práctica global del Banco de SRE a través de interacciones permanentes y de alta frecuencia, buscando sinergias.    · Identifica mejoras en el rendimiento del software, determinación de deuda técnica y calidad del activo digital para promover la mejora continua del negocio a través de post-mortem e identificación de causas raíces. Buscando mejorar la experiencia del cliente, reducir actividades operacionales y hacer más eficiente el trabajo de los equipos de desarrollo de producto.    · Identifica y promueve, en base a la colaboración con el resto de los líderes técnicos, Product Support y el negocio, la creación de frameworks de gestión de incidentes, buscando un modelo de gestión 24x7 para los incidentes de los activos digitales.    · Realiza coaching y entrenamiento a toda el área de desarrollo de software en aspectos operacionales, para que los equipos creen con consideraciones de observabilidad, monitoreo, medición de SLO, con el propósito de robustecer la arquitectura y confiabilidad de dicho sofware.    · Documenta en una base de aprendizaje toda la gestión operacional de los servicios digitales del banco. Analiza las causas raíces de los incidentes para facilitar y Gestionar la resolución de las mismas por áreas de producto support , operaciones y el negocio en pro de aumentar los promedios de disponibilidad y latencia con una práctica de mejora continua.    · Transmite, aplica y promueve tanto la adopción de la filosofía SRE y los principios ágiles, como el uso y desarrollo de distintas técnicas de mejora continua en calidad.    · Comprende la cultura de riesgo del Banco y cómo debe considerarse el apetito de riesgo en las actividades y decisiones diarias.   Requisitos: Ingeniero o técnico en informática o carrera afín.  • Mínimo de 3 años de experiencia creando software  • Experiencia y conocimiento en distintos lenguajes de programación, frameworks, utilitarios y otras tecnologías usadas por el equipo.  • Conocimiento del flujo del negocio, implementación y tendencias.  • Experiencia en negocios complejos o procesos técnicos y sus implicancias dentro de su área de especialidad.  • Excelentes habilidades de comunicación con capacidad de influir en la toma de decisiones de los stakeholders.  • Habilidades para liderar equipos con miembros que tienen opiniones y niveles de experiencia distintos.  · Conocimientos avanzados en Metodologías Ágiles, Lean Six Sigma, Design Thinking, kanban, Management 3.0, Scrum u otro.

Title: Full-Stack Developer
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: ¿Quiénes somos? En Healthatom somos un equipo de personas que cree que la tecnología debe ser un aliado en el fortalecimiento de accesos fundamentales en el mundo, uno de ellos: la salud. Por eso creamos soluciones que facilitan la gestión del día a día de cientos de clínicas, consultas y centros médicos de diversas especialidades. Hoy, somos más de 120 personas que, con valores como la excelencia, honestidad y compromiso, trabajan a diario para ser el partner tecnológico líder en el mundo de la salud. Con presencia en más de 20 países, y con más de 60 mil usuarios, nuestro propósito es mejorar el servicio y el acceso a la salud de las personas. Hoy estamos viviendo un proceso de expansión, donde queremos incorporar al talento que logrará cumplir los próximos desafíos, ¡¡¡sé parte de nuestra tribu!!  Funciones del cargo Desarrollar y mantener funcionalidades de procesos y software. Resolver de forma ágil problemas/emergencias que se presenten en el día a día en su campo de gestión. Desarrollar y adecuar diversas soluciones prediseñadas, manteniendo la calidad y disponibilidad de los productos. Revisar cambios en códigos de productos previa implementación. Apoyar y gestionar el traspaso de conocimiento en formación de productos a otros equipos de la empresa  Requisitos Mínimos Titulados en Ingeniería Civil o Ingeniería en Informática Al menos 2 años de experiencia en cargo y/o funciones similares. Manejo de tecnologías de bases de datos (lenguajes). Desarrollo de lenguajes backend (PHP). Lenguajes de programación de frontend (Lenguajes de Javascript y Typescript, idealmente React). Conceptos de diseño de interfaces y experiencia usuaria, ideal manejo de estilos usando CSS. Tecnologías y librerías vigentes   Beneficios de trabajar con nosotros Seguro complementario de salud (solo CL) Trabajo remoto Semana de vacaciones extra Día libre de cumpleaños para que puedas celebrar Aguinaldos Betterfly para tu bienestar Udemy para tu capacitación

Title: Lead Python Developer
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Description Req. #030690093 When you join EPAM as a  Lead Python Developer  , you will discover a broad range of challenging and engaging projects that will allow you to use your skills to create everything from data analytics solutions to web applications. You will get the chance to Engineer the Future of all kinds of different industries while having unlimited access to learning tools so you can become the best version of you. What You’ll Do Lead and communicate project scoping, roadmap, architecture discussions within development team Own the development and maintenance of the backend of our client’s codebase to include associated open-source product and CI/CD pipeline, with willingness and ability to function as full-stack engineer Mentor and lead members of the development team to include leading and coordination of technical work efforts Participate in requirements gathering and troubleshooting activities Promote a metrics-based software development culture of quality, collaboration, rapid delivery Requirements Demonstrated enterprise experience as a well-rounded Principal-Level Python developer with 5+ years’ experience working in technically complex environments, data warehouse, building REST APIs, microservices architecture, automated CI/CD tools and processes, as well as Linux, etc In-depth understanding of OOP, design patterns, data structures, algorithms, data integrity, software composability, and concurrency 2+ years of enterprise experience writing advanced SQL queries and a willingness and ability to grow in this area Highly collaborative team player with ability to build trust and relationships with stakeholders, holding other team members accountable for their best possible effort Experience working ideally with Flask, but Django and FastAPI are acceptable Ability to understand the whole system communication protocols between all the components Fluent spoken and written English (B2+) Benefits Learning Culture Professional growth opportunities Improved medical coverage Lunch Allowance Allowance for Internet and electricity National Holiday Bonus Christmas Bonus We offer We trust our people. We believe in team distribution and that you know what you are doing, which is why you will be able to work remotely and have a flexible schedule   We are both proud of working within a diverse and inclusive environment and acting in our role as an equal opportunities’ employer. You are welcome at EPAM for who you are.   You will be challenged while working side-by side with the best talent globally. We work with top-notch technologies, constantly seeking out new industry trends and best practices   We are a global design community eager to share knowledge, experiences, and mentoring. You will learn, contribute, and grow with us How does it sound to know you can have a 20+year career with us constantly growing and without the need to look elsewhere? We offer access to learning platforms, classes, and workshops to support your development. You will be set up for success with our clear career paths and support in helping you achieve the goals you set for yourself, both personal and professional   We seek improvement in a proactive manner. You have the freedom to make recommendations, suggestions or simply comment on things without the pressure of adhering to hierarchy or strict processes   We work with a broad range of clients: Media, Entertainment, Life Sciences, Automotive, Finance, Technology, and Travel. You will play a key role in growing their business and potentially work in multiple new industries   About EPAM EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential   Apply

Se prefieren ciudadanos estadounidenses o residentes permanentes. Title: SOFTWARE & PERFORMANCE ENGINEER
Ciudad: Las Condes, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team. Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet. We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization. Position overview: Support and coordinate the Software deployment activities over the wind turbines fleet. Analyze performance and operation of the wind turbine systems with a general perspective, identifying and analyzing the root cause for any potential issue. How To Contribute To Our Vision Provide engineering support to the operations team by performing the following activities: Technical assessment in the functionality, health and performance of the turbine control, performance and software implementations. Suggest engineering solutions to address customers’ control and performance issues to design team Prepare and participate in technical meetings with customers (remotely or in person) and agreed to lead on priority topics Prepare and modify turbine operational parameters for software upgrades Identify technical issues trends and occurrences within the fleet and prepare technical awareness documentation to be followed by the site operations team  Manage and coordinate technical discussions with internal & external customers in the Region. Responsible for multiple major projects of the high complexity requiring forefront-of-the-field & innovative solutions Lead investigations using root cause analysis and continuous improvement techniques Collaboration with International teams and working in different company cultures which requires proven international experience and cross-cultural understanding. What You Need To Make a Difference Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Mechanical Engineering, Control Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a related field (or foreign degree equivalent) and has solid experience in the job offered or in an acceptable alternate occupation Must have solid experience with the following skill: leading complex turbine power production issues in response to customer claims or internal improvement projects Must have solid experience with the following skills: demonstrated ability to lead discussions on performance claims at wind turbine and park (wind farm) level with customers/owners; experience leading root cause investigations to understand, contain and potentially solve incidents in a geared turbine Expert use of diagnostic tools and data manipulation programs (i.e. MATLAB, Python, R, SCADA, MySQL, C++, Tableau, etc.) as demonstrated by the development of tools and proven results of analysis data Knowledge of industry standards, such as IEC 61400, used in performance testing and metrics Must have solid experience with the following skills: experience providing negotiation support during modifications & upgrades; and experience recommending solutions to improve customer metrics on output and efficiency based on calculations and data analysis Must have very good knowledge of English (C1 or C2) Approximately 20% travel required to offices and wind turbine sites both domestically and internationally. In return of your commitment we offer you… Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization Flexible working hours as well as home-office (depending on work demand) Attractive remuneration package Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more Empowering our people https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees How do you imagine the future https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face. “U.S. applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more,  Click here. ” Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Brazil and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.   We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Python)
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Description EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multicultural teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential. You are curious, persistent, logical, and clever — a true techie at heart. You enjoy living by the code of your craft and developing smart solutions for complex problems. If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a  Python Senior Software Engineer . Scroll down to learn more about the position’s responsibilities and requirements. OUR VALUE, OUR PEOPLE We aim to deliver truly transformative solutions around the world, with top-notch technologies, in high-performance professional teams. But none of these would be possible without our people, and that’s where you come in. As an EPAMer you will always be expanding your knowledge, facing and addressing the biggest challenges, and becoming the best version of yourself, both personally and professionally. We care about your development and to support your growth in the company, there are many career paths you can follow. Some of the positions you can grow into are  Lead Software Engineer  or any of our  Advanced Engineering positions . #REF_HOU_CL What You’ll Do Understand the client’s business model in order to implement an effective technological solution that generates a positive impact on the end-users and the organization in general.  Guide the client in the selection of the best technological path to take, in order to meet or exceed their needs.  Work in collaboration with team members and the different business and technology areas to effectively respond to any queries raised and provide information that may support product development.  Seek creative solutions for any client issues, both proactively and reactively.  Ensure that applications are end-user friendly.  Predict potential problems in backend integration and the maintenance of the application or website.  Analyze, design and develop web portals and mobile applications from the perspective of a client in a distributed system.   Design products that guarantee compatibility with multiple devices.  What You Have Have advanced knowledge of front-end technologies such as modern HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST, and JSON.  Experience with modern unit testing frameworks such as Mocha or Chai.   Be familiar with React, Redux, or Webpack.  Experience designing and building production-level web applications.  Understanding of front-end architecture and building large-scale single-page web applications.  Have experience executing application testing.  Have the ability to speak and write English (minimum B2 level).  We offer We trust our people. We believe in team distribution and that you know what you are doing, which is why you will be able to work remotely and have a flexible schedule We are both proud of working within a diverse and inclusive environment and acting in our role as an equal opportunities’ employer. You are welcome at EPAM for who you are You will be challenged while working side-by side with the best talent globally. We work with top-notch technologies, constantly seeking out new industry trends and best practices We are a global design community eager to share knowledge, experiences, and mentoring. You will learn, contribute, and grow with us How does it sound to know you can have a 20+year career with us constantly growing and without the need to look elsewhere? We offer access to learning platforms, classes, and workshops to support your development. You will be set up for success with our clear career paths and support in helping you achieve the goals you set for yourself, both personal and professional We seek improvement in a proactive manner. You have the freedom to make recommendations, suggestions or simply comment on things without the pressure of adhering to hierarchy or strict processes We work with a broad range of clients: Media, Entertainment, Life Sciences, Automotive, Finance, Technology, and Travel. You will play a key role in growing their business and potentially work in multiple new industries   Apply

Title: Site Reliability Engineer (Plazo Fijo)
Ciudad: Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: El  Site Reliability Manager  se integrará a la Gerencia de Arquitectura. El rol de SRE garantiza que los servicios del Banco, tanto nuestros sistemas internos críticos como aquellos visibles desde el exterior, tengan la estabilidad y disponibilidad apropiadas para las necesidades de nuestros clientes finales y una tasa rápida de mejoras, así como la escalabilidad y desempeño apropiado. Además, el SRE también es una mentalidad y un conjunto de enfoques para ejecutar mejores sistemas en producción: construcción de nuestras propias soluciones creativas de ingeniería para problemas de operaciones comunes en el Banco. En este rol tendrás la oportunidad de: Participación en la mejora de todo el ciclo de vida de los servicios, desde el inicio y el diseño, hasta la implementación, operación y refinamiento. Asegurar la integridad del desarrollo y su escalabilidad Desarrollo de herramientas para el Banco (toolkit) con foco en el reliability de la plataforma. Generación activa de una base de conocimientos que sea reutilizable por los equipos de DevOps (Desarrollo de software y Operaciones Cloud). Apoyo a los servicios antes de que se activen a través de actividades como consultoría de diseño de sistemas, desarrollo de plataformas y marcos de software, planificación de capacidad y revisiones de lanzamiento. Mantenga los servicios una vez que estén activos midiendo y monitoreando la disponibilidad, la latencia y el estado general del sistema. Escale los sistemas de manera sostenible a través de mecanismos como la automatización, y desarrolle sistemas impulsando cambios que mejoren la confiabilidad y la velocidad. Practique una respuesta a incidentes sostenible y conduce postmortems Fomentar la cultura del conocimiento siendo evangelizador tecnológico alentando el desarrollo con visión de futuro Para tener éxito en esta posición necesitas: Ingeniero Informático o Carrera afín. Más de 3 años de experiencia en diseño, ingeniería, liderando un servicio enterprise end-to-end, ya sea en ingeniería de servicio o roles de ingeniería. Más de 3 años de experiencia en gestión de incidentes y cambios. Fuertes habilidades de debugging en Java Requerida experiencia en desarrollo en Angular 5 o superior, javascript (ES2017), Typescript, HTML, CSS y SASS Experiencia con sistemas de monitoreo, análisis y alertas. Experiencia con sistema Windows y Unix Experiencia con el funcionamiento de Azure, Kubernetes, Containers y Docker  Experiencia con el desarrollo utilizando bases de datos PostgreSQL, MongoDb, Redis y SQL Server Experiencia utilizando metodologías ágiles Es aún mejor si tienes: Inglés Intermedio Experiencia en Microfrontend ( framework SingleSPA) Modalidad de trabajo del cargo: Full flexible, 5 días remotos semanales. En Bci buscamos innovación, calidad de servicio y una alta orientación al cumplimiento de objetivos. Si reúnes estas características, te invitamos a postular con nosotros.

Title: Software Development Engineer in Test
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Recognized as one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, Launchpad provides next-generation integration platform capabilities for connecting and managing enterprise automation and data integration. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, our operations span both North and South Americas, with a second headquarter located in Santiago, Chile. In 2021, we were recognized as the winner of the BC Tech Associations Technology Impact Awards 'Company of The Year: Growth'. We recognize the global truth that today, every company is a tech company. To succeed, every company everywhere needs their data and workflows to be integrated and automated. That understanding gave us the confidence to compete with our sector's leading providers, win top-level contracts, and build a truly world-class list of clients that includes Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more. Our vision is to bring people and technology together to work seamlessly to achieve extraordinary business outcomes and create more efficient societies. If this sounds like something you want to be part of, we’d love to hear from you. Responsibilities: Define and write test plans and test cases Develop and maintain automated test scripts using Python Conduct hardware in the loop testing and ensure proper functioning of embedded systems Utilize diagnostic tools for Automotive and experience using Vector tools Understand HIL test methods to ensure the correct testing procedures are being used Communicate and document testing procedures and results effectively Requirements: Bachelor's degree in engineering or equivalent real-world experience 4+ years of experience in defining tests and developing test automation 4+ years of experience writing clear Python code for testing automation 4+ years of experience with hardware in the loop testing Familiarity with Embedded Systems Knowledge of CAN and Ethernet buses and diagnostic tools for Automotive Experience using Vector tools Outstanding communication and written skills Bonus: Experience developing in C, C++ GitHub, Git experience Experience with automated test frameworks (e.g., Pytest, Robot Framework), Jira, svn/git, and Continuous Integration systems (e.g., Jenkins, CircleCI) Experience testing medical devices, aviation, automotive, or other safety-critical applications Why work for Launchpad? 100% remote People first culture Excellent compensation in US Dollars Hardware setup for working from home Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia Training allowances Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc.  ...and more! At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally. Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

Title: Cloud Engineer
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: TRABAJA CON UN PROPÓSITO Súmate a nuestra área de  Accenture Technology  y sé parte del cambio! Te invitamos a abrir las puertas del mundo digital donde podrás desarrollar tu talento para crecer, aprender y certificarte en las tecnologías más avanzadas, proporcionar innovación continua, ágil y participar de nuevos negocios. Descubre el compromiso y la energía que dedicamos a transformar la forma de trabajar de nuestros clientes y comunidad, con una mirada hacia el futuro. Actualmente nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un  Ingeniero Cloud   con ganas de enfrentar nuevos desafíos ¿Qué desafíos  te esperan?  Diseñar arquitecturas cloud El ingeniero Cloud trabaja en estrecha colaboración con equipos de desarrollo y arquitectos para diseñar y construir arquitecturas cloud robustas. Esto implica la selección adecuada de servicios en la nube, la planificación de la escalabilidad, la seguridad y el rendimiento, y la implementación de las mejores prácticas. 2. Implementación y configuración Se encarga de implementar y configurar los servicios y recursos en la nube, como máquinas virtuales, redes, almacenamiento y bases de datos. Esto implica la automatización de procesos y el uso de herramientas y tecnologías adecuadas para garantizar una infraestructura estable y fácilmente gestionable. 3. Optimización y monitoreo El ingeniero Cloud supervisa y optimiza constantemente la infraestructura en la nube para garantizar su rendimiento y eficiencia. Esto implica la identificación y resolución de cuellos de botella, la gestión de la capacidad, la implementación de políticas de escalado automático y la configuración de sistemas de monitoreo para obtener métricas y alertas relevantes. 4. Seguridad y cumplimiento Es responsable de garantizar la seguridad de la infraestructura y los datos en la nube. Esto incluye la implementación de medidas de seguridad robustas, la gestión de accesos y permisos, el cifrado de datos sensibles y el cumplimiento de las regulaciones y estándares de seguridad aplicables. 5. Colaboración y soporte El ingeniero Cloud colabora estrechamente con otros equipos de tecnología, como desarrollo de software, operaciones y seguridad, para garantizar la integración ¿Qué skills necesitas para este desafío? Más de 2 años de experiencia en la industria en Azure Cloud 1 años de experiencia trabajando con Terraform Sólida experiencia trabajando con Git Conocimiento de herramientas DevOps, pipelines de CI CD, IaC Personas que investigan de forma independiente a través de la documentación disponible para comprender diferentes estándares y formas de trabajar Nice to have Certificación de administrador de Azure Conocimiento de las mejores prácticas y filosofía de DevOps. Dominio intermedio alto del idioma inglés Comprensión de Azure VMs, servicios IaaS, configuraciones HA. ¿Por qué elegir Accenture?  Un lugar de trabajo único, descubre algunos de los beneficios que tenemos para ti : 💪 Desarrollo de carrera 💯 Jornadas Flex 📚 +30 mil capacitaciones y cursos disponibles (online y presencial) ⭐ ¡Certificaciones gratuitas mediante nuestros partners! +900 certificados en Chile 🎉 ¡Nueva experiencia de onboarding global! +6.000 personas recibidas en el Metaverso a nivel LATAM 🏆 Bonos y aguinaldos 👩‍⚕️ Seguro complementario de salud (sin deducible ni copago) 🎂 Día de cumpleaños libre 👨‍👩Licencias de Paternidad & Maternidad Extendida 🌎 Red global 🌈Elegida la compañía más diversa e inclusiva del mundo Sobre nosotros:   + de 715.000 colaboradores a nivel global.  + de 1.600 Talentos en Chile.  3 oficinas en el país.  Proyectos en diversas industrias.

Tu objetivo será crear aplicaciones web completas y funcionales, abarcando tanto el desarrollo frontend como backend. ¿Cuáles serán tus principales funciones?  Desarrollar e implementar plataformas, aplicaciones o funcionalidades tanto en Front-End como Back-End  Participar en el levantamiento de requerimientos con el cliente y/o usuario final para construir, probar y generar el producto, de acuerdo con tiempos y metas definidas.  Seguir los estándares de desarrollo y buenas definidas, además de documentar cambios y entregar la información necesaria para las pruebas de sus cambios.  Generar los paquetes de instalación para producción, además de la creación de interfaces de usuarios.  Hacer seguimiento de las mejoras continuas en los diferentes sistemas, plataformas y aplicaciones.  Hacer cumplir Reglamento Interno, Políticas Corporativas u otras normativas dispuestas por la organización. Requisitos:  Título Profesional en carreras como: Ingeniero informático o similar.  Al menos dos años de experiencia en el cargo. Conocimientos en:  Desarrollo de software (excluyente)  Base de datos Sql Server  Dominio de SQL, T-SQL, SP y ETL.  Programación Orientado a objetos .net (C#) (excluyente)  Tecnologías API como SOAP y REST. (excluyente)  Base de datos Sql Server (excluyente)  Power BI  Git Jornada de trabajo:  Articulo 22. Modalidad:  Presencial, Pudahuel, Región Metropolitana. Te ofrecemos un excelente ambiente laboral, asignaciones de fiestas patrias y navidad, desayuno y almuerzo dentro de las instalaciones de la empresa, medio día de cumpleaños libre y otros beneficios serán explicados en el proceso inductivo. ¡Ven y Postula con nosotros! Somos el Grupo ASSA ABLOY Nuestra gente nos ha convertido en el líder mundial en soluciones de acceso. A cambio, les abrimos las puertas allá donde vayan. Con casi 52.000 colegas en más de 70 países diferentes, ayudamos a miles de millones de personas a experimentar un mundo más abierto. Nuestras innovaciones hacen que todo tipo de espacios -físicos y virtuales- sean más seguros y de más fácil acceso. Como empleador, valoramos los resultados, no los títulos ni los antecedentes. Permitimos que nuestros empleados construyan su carrera en torno a sus aspiraciones y a las nuestras, apoyándoles con comentarios periódicos, formación y oportunidades de desarrollo. Nuestros compañeros piensan ampliamente en dónde pueden tener más impacto, y les animamos a desarrollar su función a nivel local, regional o incluso internacional. Al dar la bienvenida a nuevas personas, es importante para nosotros tener equipos diversos e inclusivos, y valoramos las diferentes perspectivas y experiencias.

Title: Visual Basic Developer (with Data experience) (Remote) (5833 USD/Mes) [Chile]
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: About The Position Data Modeler (DM) Description Summary: The DM will report to the Manager, Data and will work within an Agile scrum team. The DM works closely with its internal customers to define and implement structured data systems, ETL flows and Business Intelligence (BI) content for consumption by end-customers within the company's platform. The DM cooperates with our Technical Product Managers (TPM) role to interview analysts and gather their requirements. He/she/they work closely with a Data Analyst and Software Engineer to ensure that the developed data solutions align both with the TPM’s requirements and Engineered solutions. The DM embodies knowledge of the Platform’s data systems and associated ETL flows and data visualizations. The DM delivers value to end customers by giving a business analyst a means of bringing their data product to market. The DM provides stewardship of the Platform’s data concerns. The DM ensures that technical debt is identified, documented and advocated for as/when appropriate. Solutions that the DM develops may first require a feasibility study or Proof-of-Concept (PoC) be executed by the DM, the results of which the DM will share with all stakeholders. Existing and potential areas of work:  Data Modeling o Designing and implementing data models embodied in structured files and data stores  ETL o Extract, Transform and Load of any data relevant to the Platform o Monitoring and bug fixes in PROD  BI o Data visualizations and inter or intra-navigation  Data o Data Science, Machine Learning o Search optimization o Structured data systems o Unstructured data systems o Data Caching o Data persistence o Data recovery  Co-interview analysts, in cooperation with a TPM, to identify achievable scopes of work (SOWs) of business value  Co-author data model SOWs with business analysts and TPMs  Breakdown data model SOWs into actionable Tasks and size those Tasks  Develop VB data interchanges with data stores for use in MS Excel  Write and maintain ETL dataflows that move data between stores or into new formats  Write user guide documentation for analysts who use the data models produced by the team  Interface with external data source(s) and/or vendor(s) to store new model data in an ETL target db  Document all ETL flows and interconnections in Confluence  Cost ETL solutions  Build and retain all data intellectual property for the Platform  Provide end-customer technical support during high-severity platform situations  Monitor and debug dataflows in PROD  Coordinate with the Engineering and Architecture teams, providing information on technical investigations into buy/partner decision options, and make associated recommendations Requirements None Benefits Vacaciones / Flexibilidad de Trabajo Trabajo Remoto: Globalmente remoto 6127_2_10072023

Destacamos por tener una cultura Innovadora, Diversa e Inclusiva, que genera riqueza para nuestras generaciones actuales y futuras. Valoramos nuestras diferencias y lo que hace a cada persona única, es por ello que promovemos la diversidad, equidad y conciliación en todas nuestras prácticas. Hoy contamos con una política en esta materia y todas nuestras ofertas laborales se enmarcan en la ley 21.015, que incentiva la inclusión de personas con discapacidad en el ámbito laboral. En caso que durante tu postulación requieras algún ajuste razonable para participar del proceso, cuéntanos para que podamos apoyarte y participes en igualdad de condiciones.

Title: Growth Hacking Analyst
Ciudad: Las Condes, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: En Scotia Chile nos encontramos en búsqueda de nuestro próximo Analista Growth Hacking del equipo de Ventas Digitales & Engagement, quién deberá contribuir al éxito general de la Banca Retail y específicamente con los objetivos estratégicos de la gerencia de Ventas Digitales y Engagement. En tu rol deberás apoyar la gestión del funnel de ventas para encontrar oportunidades de negocio con foco en la explotación de activos digitales. En esta línea, el rol es fundamental para apoyar en la ideación, descubrimiento y co-creación de nuevas iniciativas de explotación en conjunto con el equipo de adquisición y vinculación. Este rol es clave para lograr la estrategia y los objetivos propuestos por la División, por esto monitorear las iniciativas desplegas y poder construir reportes asociados a la gestión realizada para detectar oportunidades y medir el existo de las mismas una vez implementadas. Responsabilidades: • Basado en la visión de Banca Digital, coordina en conjunto con su líder el despliegue y seguimiento de iniciativas de ventas en canales digitales asociadas a la adquisición de nuevos clientes y su vinculación temprana, cuidando de poder gestionar y detectar el transito del funnel de forma adecuada. • Monitorea las acciones desplegadas dentro de la estrategia de explotación de ventas digitales, con el objetivo de incrementar las ventas y adquisición a través de los productos y servicios disponibles en Scotia. Promueve nuevas formas de gestión y análisis de las iniciativas realizadas o por realizar. • Debe realizar seguimiento de las diferentes acciones comerciales que se desplieguen, medir sus ratios de conversión o winrates (WR) con el objetivo de maximizar la conversión de estas y asegurarse que su objetivo de cumpla en el tiempo. • Debe diseñar los instrumentos de gestión necesarios para medir de forma correcta las palancas principales de ventas digitales en el ámbito de la adquisición y vinculación temprana. • Debe distribuir informes de seguimiento a stakeholders y participar de forma activa en la presentación de avance de presupuesto e iniciativas comerciales en quarter business review (QBR). • Investiga respecto a funcionalidades, productos, tendencias, en bancos y fintechs con directa relación a segmentos de clientes de Scotia, con el objetivo de prever y anticiparse a cambios en la industria y analizar acciones para mitigar. • Debe entregar hallazgos detectados en los diferentes flujos digitales atingentes al rol, al equipo de Digital Solutions, Marketing y/o Business Intelligence según corresponda para disminuir las caídas del funnel. • Detectar GAPs o brechas respecto a planes digitales y/o presupuesto para realizar acciones correctivas en conjunto con Manager del área y líder respectivo. • Comprende la cultura de riesgo del Banco y cómo debe considerarse el apetito de riesgo en las actividades y decisiones diarias. • Medir continuamente iniciativas e idealmente plantear escenarios de AB Testing para desplegar soluciones digitales. • Responsable de gestionar la información contextual de cara a clientes tanto inbound como outbound digital. Requisitos: • Ingeniero informático, industrial, comercial o carrera afín. • Mínimo de 2 años de experiencia creando productos digitales, explotación o áreas de productos y servicios bancarios o relacionados de marketing digital. • Conocimientos sobre los productos financieros desde el puntos de vista comercial o de gestión. • Conocimiento en modelos de descubrimiento de nuevos productos bajo la filosofía de customer centric.( p. Ej. Desing Thinking, prácticas Lean o similar). • Capacidad análitica de gestión de funnels. • Nivel de Inglés intermedio.

Title: Mobile Apps Engineer (Swift) (Remote) (8750 USD/Mes) [Chile]
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: About The Position About Us As a mobile apps software engineer you’ll share ownership of our development infrastructure, including (but not limited to) our iOS and Android apps, our website, our BSS/OSS and CRM customer billing, relationship, and provisioning software, our Node.js mobile app server architecture, and all other integrations and dev stacks we utilize. Day-to-day, there’s a good chance you’ll have more than a few opportunities to show off your creativity, finding solutions for complex problems and leading our team around or through the many roadblocks that exist in the bureaucratic world of telecommunications. Key Responsibilities Leading our development efforts from conception to deployment, working with engineering, product, and design to constantly rollout updates and maintain our apps, website, and CRM. Work with leadership and your dev team colleagues to support building out our development team, while identifying our next dev phases and roadmaps. Making important architectural decisions towards the development stack and processes for the team and our systems. Assisting all members of the product and engineering team to implement, solve, and create amazing user first experiences throughout our product offerings. Helping define and implement our development team’s day-to-day schedules through stand-ups, sprint planning meetings, retrospectives, and demos. The “go-to-person” for our technical teams to rely on for leadership, decisions making, and information. Solving problems through creativity and communication. Our teams are remote and a large part of mastering this role will be to improve and help build our communication across teams and timezones. Key Languages And Skills (Swift, Kotlin, TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js, Yaf PHP, and mongoDB) is great. Our apps rely heavily on Apple Pay and Google Pay to provide a seamless customer experience, so familiarity with those APIs, past experience building customer onboarding and billing-focused apps, and knowledge of merchant-initiated variable-amount recurring billing is beneficial. Knowledgeable with agile software development practices such as Kanban and Scrum. Experiencing managing or working to help lead a technical team in an agile environment — if you’ve done this in the early stages at a startup this would be immensely valuable. You’ll need to juggle, most likely early and almost certainly often, plenty of projects, tasks, deadlines, fires, ideas, and potentially even a technological crisis or two10. Being able to zoom in on what matters, even when there might be a lot of noise, and staying focused through at least some level of sustained chaos will be a really good skillset to have Experience supporting cross-functional teams, and understanding the value of diverse input from stakeholders, with a focus on nurturing growth and instilling confidence in the team by supporting their growth and development. Demonstrated ability to manage through organizational complexity and ambiguity, show adaptability in the face of chance, and experience working with teams in a fast paced environment. Critical decision-making abilities, takes ownership to respond to problems promptly, with diligent follow-through on areas of responsibility. Ability to liaise effectively with other departments and leadership to enhance internal systems, policies, and processes. Experience working in a Lean-Agile environment for projects and software development is key. Experience working in a union environment is an asset.  Requirements None Benefits Vacaciones / Flexibilidad de Trabajo Trabajo Remoto: Globalmente remoto 5984_4_10072023

Title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer, Environment Automation
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: The GitLab DevSecOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 2,000+ team members and values that foster a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute. Learn more about Life at GitLab . An Overview Of This Role As a Site Reliability Engineer at GitLab, you are responsible for keeping all user-facing services and other GitLab production systems running smoothly. Our SREs are a blend of pragmatic operators and software craftspeople that apply sound engineering principles, operational discipline, and mature automation to our operating environments and the GitLab codebase. As an SRE within the Environment Automation specialization, you primarily focus on operating a large number of GitLab environments, through automating all workflows - from provisioning new environments to daily operating tasks. This is the main difference between Environment Automation SRE and other SRE’s at GitLab; your day to day will be occupied by automation tasks of a large number of GitLab environments (and the environments used by GitLab), and operational tasks across many environments. Some Examples Of The Projects You Could Work On Automation used to operate a large number of GitLab environments  Projects that create deployment packages of GitLab such as, GitLab Helm Chart, omnibus-gitlab, etc.  Building Dedicated Gitlab setups using infrastructure as code automation with Ansible and Terraform and integrate with Cloud Native services from cloud providers (e.g GCP, AWS)  Building Tools to orchestrate infrastructure as code workloads.    What you’ll do  Build: Automating every operational task is a core requirement for Environment Automation SRE. E.g. package updates, configuration changes across all customer platforms without interruptions, tools for automatic provisioning of customer facing services, etc.  Maintain: Develop a good (early) warning system and system that allows for reliable and quick maintenance tasks, such as library upgrades, version migrations and similar.  Plan: Develop monitoring and alerting systems that predict capacity needs based on the customer usage patterns. Plan for new service rollouts, expansion of existing services and preparing advice for customers to optimize their resource consumption.  Respond: Respond to user emergencies, platform alerts and support requests.  Enhance: Implement new, and update existing security measures for the protection of GitLab infrastructure.  Collaborate: Work with other engineering stakeholders on resolving larger architectural bottlenecks and participate by offering a large scale operational point of view. Work in close collaboration with software development teams to shape the future roadmap and establish strong operational readiness across teams.    What you’ll bring  Experience in running and operating production workloads  Strong programming skills - preferably with Ruby and/or Go.  Strong background with Infrastructure as a Code technologies, and libraries powering GitLab, such as Terraform and Ansible. Experience with data templating tools such as Jsonnet would be considered a bonus.  Ability to reason about large systems - how they work and can be operated on a large scale, edge cases, failure modes, and behaviors.  Experience regularly interacting with customers, and a focus on resolving their requests with a sense of urgency.  About The Team GitLab’s Dedicated team's in which the SRE Environment Automation sits has the mission to create a fully managed, single-tenant GitLab environment, served through a GitLab Dedicated platform . It is developed to remove any manual interactions with customer tenant installations, and to ensure that the customer tenants are fully focused on unlocking the power of The One DevOps Platform How GitLab Will Support You  Benefits to support your health, finances, and well-being   All remote , asynchronous work environment   Flexible Paid Time Off   Team Member Resource Groups   Equity Compensation & Employee Stock Purchase Plan   Growth and development budget   Parental leave   Home office support  Please note that we welcome interest from candidates with varying levels of experience; many successful candidates do not meet every single requirement. Additionally, studies have shown that people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to a job unless they meet every single qualification. If you're excited about this role, please apply and allow our recruiters to assess your application. The base salary range for this role’s listed level is currently for residents of listed locations only. Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. See more information on our benefits and equity . Sales roles are also eligible for incentive pay targeted at up to 100% of the offered base salary. Colorado/Washington pay range $124,300 — $239,700 USD California/New York/New Jersey pay range $124,300 — $266,400 USD Country Hiring Guidelines:  GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process. Privacy Policy:  Please review our Recruitment Privacy Policy. Your privacy is important to us. GitLab is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. GitLab’s policies and practices relating to recruitment, employment, career development and advancement, promotion, and retirement are based solely on merit, regardless of race, color, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression), national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, mental or physical disability, genetic information (including family medical history), discharge status from the military, protected veteran status (which includes disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, active duty wartime or campaign badge veterans, and Armed Forces service medal veterans), or any other basis protected by law. GitLab will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. See also GitLab’s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law . If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation , please let us know during the recruiting process .

Forensic attention to detail. Title: Python Engineer - Data Center Hardware Integration (Greater Boston Area)
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: This role is home based in the Boston metropolitan area, and you are expected to be able to visit our Boston lab regularly, 4 - 6 times per month. This is a Python software engineering opportunity for a computer lab engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and the latest server and network technologies. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company. If you love hacking in your home lab and are curious about hardware, you will love this opportunity. As an Python Engineer - Data Center Hardware Integration in Canonical, you will be responsible for the day-to-day management and operations of our lab in the Boston area which serves as a centre point for Ubuntu server certification of US based silicon and server designs. This includes software defined hardware management, working with, and developing data centre automation tooling (MAAS), interacting with vendors, asset tracking and handling deliveries. What you'll do Own a fully automated server lab with the latest server and network silicon from leading vendors.  Use your Python development skills to develop the Metal as a Service (MAAS) software to work with a large variety of server and network hardware.  Actively expand MAAS functionality by creating integrations with testing and scheduling software such as Testflinger.  Manage the physical setup of the lab, ensure it is well structured and tidy, and execute changes either self or through remote hands.  Work to standardise processes, configurations, and procedures in cooperation with engineers in our other data centres.  Improve and extend hardware and network monitoring through automation.  Regularly update asset management tools to ensure accuracy and completeness of the lab's hardware.  Update of equipment firmware when appropriate/needed.  Who you are Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science or Software Engineering Python programming experience Linux Administration experience Mix of Rack and Virtual systems experience Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English Strong time management skills Ability to manage competing priorities Ability to work with a globally distributed team of passionate engineers We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your   identity , we will give your application fair consideration.
