Title: Desarrollador Power Platform
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: En TCS estamos en búsqueda de talentos como tú. Somos una empresa que tiene presencia en más de 50 países a nivel mundial, en Latinoamérica estamos en 9 países y ya somos más de 25 mil asociados que hacen parte de esta gran familia. Hoy quiero invitarte a que te unas a nosotros. Estamos en búsqueda de Desarrollador Power Platform con un fuerte enfoque en Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM con habilidades en desarrollo de servicios web, plugins, JavaScript y desarrollo en PowerApps. Funciones: Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener soluciones personalizadas en Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM. Desarrollar plugins y extensiones para ampliar la funcionalidad de Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM. Crear y mantener integraciones con servicios web y aplicaciones externas. Realizar pruebas de calidad y solucionar problemas para garantizar el rendimiento y la estabilidad de las soluciones implementadas. Mantenerse actualizado sobre las últimas actualizaciones y novedades de Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM y aplicar los conocimientos adquiridos en el desarrollo de soluciones. Requisitos: 5+ años experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo de soluciones en Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM. 5+ años experiencia en el desarrollo de plugins y extensiones para Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM. 5+ años experiencia de JavaScript y .Net para su aplicación en el contexto de Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM. Certificaciones PL-200, PL-400 Conocimientos sólidos en el desarrollo de servicios web y API. Experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones y soluciones en PowerApps. Conocimiento de los conceptos y metodologías de desarrollo ágil. Capacidad para colaborar eficazmente en equipos multidisciplinarios y comunicarse de manera clara y efectiva. Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma, priorizar tareas y gestionar plazos. Excelentes habilidades analíticas y resolutivas. Licenciatura en Informática, Ingeniería de Sistemas o un campo relacionado (deseable). Si estas interesado/a ¡POSTULA CON NOSOTROS!

Title: Sr. FullStack Developer (Vue.js/Node.js/TypeScript) (Remote) (7408 USD/Mes) [Chile]
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: About The Position The client is looking for a passionate, experienced Sr. FullStack Developer (Vue.js/Node.js/TypeScript) that can jump into a large, dynamic, enterprise-grade application and begin contributing. You love developing, seeing your work put to action and knowing that everything you work on will be used by real customers around the world. You are eager to be involved in a company that is moving a global industry to a more connected, scalable future. You will be expanding our hands-on, small and mighty, senior software development team. You will have your hands in many projects, both big and small. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and rewarding environment. The job is remote, but highly collaborative. You’ll feel immersed and connected with our senior team and our customers. Overview of you and the role: Have significant experience and expertise in Vue.js, TypeScript and Node.js and have used it to build dynamic, web-based, B2B applications Love building and writing quality code, and can do it fast and well Love weaving through complex applications and programming and finding efficient and simple ways to build them Have a an obsession for great user experiences Experience in other modern front-end and/or back-end technologies is a plus Are looking for a long-term, full-time position with a fast growing company Love working in fast-paced, start-up like environments Can get ramped up in a new environment quickly Your skills You are a front-end developer that is very strong and experienced with Vue.js (Vue 3), TypeScript and Node.js. Preferably, you have experience building other complex SaaS-based applications in vue.js. If you alternatively have equivalent experience in React.js, and are interested in, and able to quickly learn Vue, that can work too. Your development skill set also includes Typescript on the front. You have proficiency in scss, and have an eye for seamless and engaging user experiences. If you have experience with php, MariaDb and node.js, that is a huge plus. If you are knowledgeable about other modern API tools and frameworks, like Firebase, Graphql, etc., that's a plus too, as we like it when people can expand our skillset and bring new ideas to the table. You are highly self-motivated, take a high degree of pride and care in your work. You are a developer that is productive and thorough; you excel at writing high quality code fast. You are a high value contributor that goes beyond just writing the code; you can lead and come up with new and better ideas. You meet deadlines and thrive in a dynamic environment. You are eager to build and deploy amazing things. You also see the bigger picture, from the user’s perspective, and design and build to make their experience easy, intuitive and engaging. You have an innate desire to always be learning and improving. You can really understand the user’s experience, workflows and value propositions, and then carry this understanding into building, advancing and deploying even more spectacular back- and front-ends. We are looking for someone eager to dive into our front-end that can really understand the user’s experience, workflows and value propositions, and then carry this understanding into building, advancing and deploying even more spectacular back- and front-ends. Some of our solutions include: Secure, permission-based, online document management systems and data rooms Advanced user management systems CRM systems Management, centralization, digitization and visualization of data Electronic transactions in private investments Collaboration and communication tools Dynamic, do-it-yourself digital dashboards of structured and unstructured data White-labeling, theming and DIY customizations Advanced portfolio analytics API integrations Full life-cycle investor journeys Fundraising and investor servicing solutions AML/KYC applications Email systems What's unique is that as a truly all-in-one platform, all of our solutions work with each other. We combine them in ways that create more value and new possibilities for everyone. Things you will be working on Our development team is extremely agile. You will become a core part of our core team, working on multiple tasks and projects, and often shifting between things based on priorities. Your week could include helping to: build and release new features, applications and workflows enhance existing features migrate certain areas of the application from php to vue3 respond to customer needs accelerate revenue opportunities implement and own certain API integrations work with our technology partners on seamless integrations Remote, but collaborative Our team is NY based, but we live in different locations. We work remote, but are close and enjoy an open, transparent and highly collaborative environment. We stay in communication throughout each day. We use Slack to chat, video conference and screen share to keep everyone updated, work on things together and brainstorm new ideas. You will become part of this flow. This type of interaction comes naturally for you. Primary Technologies - Required Vue.js (Vue 3) Typescript scss html5 If you have extensive experience in React.js, and can pick up Vue.js, we would love to hear from you too. Technologies that are a plus PHP MariaDB Other We are aiming for you to quickly become an active, ongoing and contributing part of our team. This opportunity is a full-time position. 40 hours per week Willing or able to work on, or have substantial overlap with, Eastern time zone hours We are in New York Fluent in English You have your own computer that runs fast with high-speed Internet You have video conferencing capabilities Other Benefits Opportunity to work on a big, disruptive platform This company does a lot! We serve and bring together participants on all sides of our industry, giving each audience the advanced, yet highly intuitive workflow tools they need. Then we bring it all together. You will be involved in all of it :) Opportunity to work directly with the founders You will become part of the core development and innovation team, working directly with the CEO and the Head of Development. You will learn a ton (and you will have an opportunity to teach us too!). Opportunity to make a difference Everything you do will be used by our customers around the world. Not just that, but we are transforming an entire industry, moving it to an online, centralized state. You will be involved in this migration. Requirements None Benefits Vacaciones / Flexibilidad de Trabajo Trabajo Remoto: Globalmente remoto 6521_3_10072023

Title: Senior Full Stack Developer
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Recognized as one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, Launchpad provides next-generation integration platform capabilities for connecting and managing enterprise automation and data integration. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, our operations span both North and South Americas, with a second headquarter located in Santiago, Chile. In 2021, we were recognized as the winner of the BC Tech Associations Technology Impact Awards 'Company of The Year: Growth'. We recognize the global truth that today, every company is a tech company. To succeed, every company everywhere needs their data and workflows to be integrated and automated. That understanding gave us the confidence to compete with our sector's leading providers, win top-level contracts, and build a truly world-class list of clients that includes Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more. Our vision is to bring people and technology together to work seamlessly to achieve extraordinary business outcomes and create more efficient societies. If this sounds like something you want to be part of, we’d love to hear from you. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Full Stack Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in building SaaS solutions, with a proven track record of developing high-performing and scalable web applications. Proficiency in React, Node.js, and experience with a cloud provider (ie. AWS, GCP, Azure, etc) is required. Responsibilities of the role: Develop and maintain SaaS applications, from concept to production-ready products, following best practices and coding standards.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, UX/UI designers, and QA testers, to gather requirements and deliver high-quality software solutions.  Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code, ensuring scalability, flexibility, and security of applications.  Optimize web applications for performance, scalability, and usability to ensure the best user experience.  Debug and resolve software defects and production issues in a timely manner.  Skills: Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in building SaaS applications.  Strong proficiency in React, Node.js, and other relevant technologies for building full-stack web applications.  Experience with relational databases (MySQL, Postgres, or something similar) Experience with at least one cloud provider (AWS, GCP, Azure, or something similar) Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.  Demonstrated ability to organize and implement highly scalable and performant web applications.  Strong problem-solving skills and ability to debug and resolve complex software defects.  Familiarity with agile development methodologies and version control systems such as Git.  Bonus: Experience with AWS services (EC2, S3, Lambda, etc) Experience with Angular Experience with C# Experience writing Microsoft Office Add-ins in OfficeJS and/or VSTO Experience with writing Chromium browser extensions using Manifest Version 3 Experience with test automation tools (ie. Selenium, Cypress, Testcafe, or something similar) Experience with Legal Tech Why work for Launchpad? 100% remote People first culture Excellent compensation in US Dollars Hardware setup for working from home Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia Training allowances Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc.  ...and more! At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally. Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

Title: Senior Application Developer Tech Lead - Java - C++
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Job Id: 23664928 The Applications Development Technology Lead Analyst is a senior level position responsible for establishing and implementing new or revised application systems and programs in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to lead applications systems analysis and programming activities. Key Responsibilities: Work in cross functional Agile teams as a senior Developer and Lead. [take part in story pointing, agile planning, story grooming where applicable, write code professionally, lead and coach other less senior developers to write their code, etc.] Partner with multiple teams to ensure appropriate integration of functions to meet goals as well as identify and define necessary system enhancements to deploy new products and process improvements. Develop comprehensive knowledge of how areas of business, such as architecture and infrastructure, integrate to accomplish business goals. Provide in-depth analysis with interpretive thinking to define issues and develop innovative solutions. Work proactively & independently to address stories and epic, and articulate issues/challenges with enough lead time to address project delivery risks. Resolve variety of high impact problems/projects through in-depth evaluation of complex business processes, system processes, and industry standards. Providing expertise in technical analysis and solving technical issues during sprint deliveries. Strong influencing skills, proactive collaborator who can communicate his/her technical decisions effectively. Code reviews, test case reviews and ensure code developed meets the requirements using best practices and tools and enable Continuous Delivery. Utilize advanced knowledge of system flow and develop standards and implement it for Component Design, Coding, Unit Testing and Debugging. Carry out adaptive changes necessitated by changes in Business Requirements and Technology. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 6-10 years of relevant experience in Apps Development or systems analysis role Extensive experience system analysis and in programming of software applications Experience in managing and implementing successful projects Subject Matter Expert (SME) in at least one area of Applications Development Ability to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate Demonstrated leadership and project management skills Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication Hands-on expert level in Java and/or C++ backend server programming is required. Strong knowledge of Java Collection framework and Multi-Threading, and Spring Boot is a plus. Strong knowledge of Microservices-based architecture and technology stack (Kafka, APIs, etc.) is preferred. Strong knowledge of Stored Procedure programming on databases such as MS-SQL, Sybase or Oracle. Knowledge of design methodologies; design of complex multi-dimensional schema. Strong Agile proactive: Sprints/Scrums, Jira, Story Pointing, Test Driven Development, Cucumber, Continuous Integration (Jenkins/TeamCity) Ability to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate. Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication. Flexible to learn and work on any language/tools to meet business objectives. Education: Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience Master's degree preferred This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required. OpSo is a dynamic, global, and diverse organization supporting operations in over 80 Countries, working with multinational corporations and national governments to propel global business and sustainable growth. We are responsible for providing technology solutions and robust applications to support the growth of our Capital Markets Business. In addition, OpSo plays a leadership role in collaborating across the ICG division to provide solutions for digitizing communications, streamlining workflow management, and reporting risk and control analytics. We have reimagined how to provide technology and services in our domain by aligning our team vision with our team culture. We encourage our people to create, explore, and adventure—stamping our identity as  Opstronauts . We invest and reinvest in two (2) main things: groundbreaking technology R&D and our people. By continually reinvesting in the dreamers, makers, and doers, we empower each other to become the industry disruptors. We are breaking the banking mold. Our Opstronaut culture thrives off our subject matter experts and diversity of thought. We are more than an organization; we are a movement. Join us. Oasys Trade Processor and Settlements is a Middle & Back-office Product Processor for Citi’s Over-the-Counter (OTC) Derivatives. It is a global application that supports OTC Derivatives Product Processing functions covering whole spectrum of asset classes including Fixed Income, FX, Equities and Commodities. Oasys Settlements handles trade settlements with clients. Application has numerous upstream & downstream real-time as well as end-of-day data flows. The successful candidate will independently design and deliver strong technology solutions following agile engineering practices (peer reviews, scrums, test driven development, Continuous integration etc.) for the OTC Derivatives business independently with little to no supervision. We are looking for a talented and passionate Lead Developer with 10+ years of working hands-on experience in Java and C++ backend programming. Candidate must be highly proficient in one of the Java / C++ technologies and at least be able to read and understand code in the other technology to be able to lead a team of Java and C++ developers. Hands on experience in Micro Services based real-time/streaming architectures and technology stacks (Kafka etc.) would be preferred. Strong SQL / Database experience is required. Ability to work independently. Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Description When you join EPAM as a Site Reliability Engineer, your duty will be to ensure that our software solutions work as expected, are highly scalable and perform according to our client’s needs. You’ll work directly with our development team to create and monitor highly efficient applications for multiple industries, while- Top performance and no downtime are always the ultimate goal. What You Have 5+ years experience as a SRE Engineer (required) A willingness to use automation and vendor integrations to improve engineering efficiency Strong understanding of mobile and web backend infrastructure technologies Expert understanding of distributed systems design and implementation Experience with enterprise integration patterns Experience with CI/CD Pipeline Development and maintenance A strong preference for test-driven development Excellent communication and priority management skills in an agile environment Responsibilities Use a wide variety of AWS cloud services to implement and support our platform architecture Automate tasks using Bash, NodeJS, ArgoCD, and other tools Create and maintain a cross-region multi-cluster Kubernetes architecture Leverage istio to mesh services together Maintain an AWS WorkSpaces infrastructure supporting our back office Model, build, and maintain infrastructure using Terraform on AWS Build, maintain, and deploy software artifacts as Docker images and containers Support our CI/CD pipelines used by Product and Release Engineering Support various teams with a high level of dedication and professionalism Build, maintain, and support InfoSec solutions based upon industry best practices Analyze stack traces and application events to improve Site Reliability Benefits Improved medical coverage- EPAMers are eligible to participate in a supplementary health insurance program that shall have the usual coverage in the industry, with the Company funding 100% of the value of the monthly premium for participation Lunch Allowance-you will receive a daily allowance of CLP $ 7.000 per working day. Enjoy a nice meal on us Allowance for internet and electricity -You will receive an allowance of CLP$15.000 per month to cover internet and electricity expenses National Holiday Bonus -We celebrate joining the Chilean Market. That’s why all our employees will receive a bonus of CLP $86,646 in September Christmas Bonus -You’ll receive an End of the Year bonus of CLP $170,539. It’ll be paid during the month of December, to ensure you have Happy Holidays! Learning Culture - We want you to be the best version of yourself, that is why we offer unlimited access to learning platforms, a wide range of internal courses, and all the knowledge you need to grow professionally Professional Growth Opportunities - We have designed a highly competitive and complete development process, where you will have all the tools to get where you have always wanted to be, personally and professionally Additional Income - Besides your regular salary, you will also have the chance to earn extra income by referring talent, being a technical interviewer, and many more ways Community Benefit - You will be part of a worldwide community of over 50,000 employees, where you can learn, challenge yourself, stand out, and share your knowledge and experience with multicultural teams! Are you open to relocation? - If you want to relocate to another country and we have the right project, we will assist you every step of the way, to help you and your family, reach your new home We offer We trust our people. We believe in team distribution and that you know what you are doing, which is why you will be able to work remotely and have a flexible schedule We are both proud of working within a diverse and inclusive environment and acting in our role as an equal opportunities’ employer. You are welcome at EPAM for who you are You will be challenged while working side-by side with the best talent globally. We work with top-notch technologies, constantly seeking out new industry trends and best practices.    We are a global design community eager to share knowledge, experiences, and mentoring. You will learn, contribute, and grow with us.    How does it sound to know you can have a 20+year career with us constantly growing and without the need to look elsewhere? We offer access to learning platforms, classes, and workshops to support your development. You will be set up for success with our clear career paths and support in helping you achieve the goals you set for yourself, both personal and professional    We seek improvement in a proactive manner. You have the freedom to make recommendations, suggestions or simply comment on things without the pressure of adhering to hierarchy or strict processes We work with a broad range of clients: Media, Entertainment, Life Sciences, Automotive, Finance, Technology, and Travel. You will play a key role in growing their business and potentially work in multiple new industries About EPAM EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.    Apply

Title: Platform Developer ($72,000 USD), Sparkrock
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Are you a high-performing software developer looking to take your technical skills to the next level? If you are a top performer, you understand that the more time you spend writing code and less time in meetings and status reporting, the more successful you will be. That’s why at Sparkrock, we believe that software developers should be focused on what they do best - producing great solutions. We believe that design and code quality is the most important part of any quality business solution. We also understand that top performers want to develop and grow. That’s why we provide continuous training and coaching focused on unlocking people’s potential. We want our consultants and engineers to be the best they can be! Imagine working for an organization where you have unlimited opportunities to grow and develop and, where you don’t have to worry about factors outside of your control, where there’s no ambiguity about what’s expected or what it takes to be successful. If you are passionate about learning and growing and want to develop into the best coder you can be, then this role is for you! What will you be doing? Most of your day is spent doing actual software development, not other meaningless activities. We have tried to cut out nonessential work, so the majority of your day is on designing, coding, and testing product solutions. Every day you'll be refining your skills to the next level. The only exception is training and development. In addition to being a great software developers, we expect our people to be product, industry, and market experts. Maintaining and building upon that expertise requires continuous coaching, training, and self-development. On average, you will spend 20% of your week on such activities. What you will NOT be doing Building and deploying custom solutions Endless meetings and presentations Getting bored with repetitive tasks Working alone Working with outdated tools What you will learn How to consistently deliver a high-quality product Will always work with the latest Business Central platform and tools available How to take your problem-solving skills to the highest level How to convert a set of acceptance criteria into a high-quality solution Responsibilities You will be expected to be an expert on the products you work on, understand problems, create solutions, and effectively communicate its benefits as well as value to stakeholders. This means that you will continuously stay up-to-date on Business Central releases and AL development platform improvements. You will participate in deep dives that uncover quality issues and pain points and propose solutions to fix them. You will participate in regular coaching and training to improve your skills. Requirements Post-secondary degree or diploma in Computer Science or a relevant field 5+ years experience in Business Central development 5+ years experience in building ERP solutions Hands-on experience building automated tests for Business Central Strong English communication (oral and written) Quality mindset and detail-oriented Nice to have Experience with Azure DevOps: Repos, Boards, Pipelines, Artifacts Previous experience in Remote jobs Benefits - We don’t call them perks, they’re just part of what makes working at Sparkrock great. We are 100% remote and global. Live your best life, wherever that may be, and never lose out on career opportunities because of it. Flexible work hours. We work asynchronously and don’t care when you’re online, just that you deliver great results. Dedication to development. We focus on career pathing for each and every one of our employees and help provide training to advance at every stage in your career. Focus on culture. Coffee chats, happy hours, cooking classes, book clubs, and more! Swag! Because who doesn’t love swag? Stipend to help set up your ideal home office. Introductions to thought leaders in the space and webinars on cutting-edge tech hot topics We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities.

Title: Salesforce Developer
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: We are looking for an experienced, Salesforce Developer to help design and implement a world-class, global network. As a Salesforce Developer, you will help build and support company’s growing business application environment – ensuring availability, reliability, and security for our users and critical business data. Together with the other members of the business applications team, you will have the opportunity to re-define how our company, designs, builds, and maintains a growing suite of applications around the world. You are right for this role if you excel at solving multi-faceted problems, managing large volumes of data, collaborating across various teams, and building world-class tools that drive impact. The ideal candidate is able to deeply understand the core business problem being addressed, balance speed and quality, and provide solution alternatives. Responsibilities Collaborate with various stakeholders to conceptualize, develop, interpret, and analyze requirements to align business process efficiencies and improvements with system functionality, and ensure the accuracy of information feeding into the CRM systems. Develop custom solutions within Salesforce (Apex/Visualforce/Lightning Framework). Verifying and regressions testing of new and existing functionality before release to end users. Maintain and continuously improve Service and Experience Cloud processes and other enterprise applications. Implement process improvements and automations through Apex to optimize and support processes. Create and update documentation to assist with maintaining and triaging newly-developed applications and integrations.  Requisitos Requirements   3+ years Salesforce.com development experience for a medium to large scale, high availability, enterprise implementation. Experience developing Apex triggers and both synchronous and asynchronous Apex classes. Experience with Trigger frameworks a plus Experience creating custom Visualforce pages and components. Experience building rich user experiences with custom Lightning components. Knowledge on Force.com coding best practices. Experience in Salesforce Lightning Design System, SOQL & SOSL, and the Salesforce data model. Proven collaborator, working successfully and building relationships across various teams including Sales, Sales Operations, Order Fulfillment, and Billing.  Experience using JavaScript, jQuery, HTML and CSS (prefereably while building Aura or Lightning Web Components). Ability to successfully translate technical requirements into independent features for development. Proficiency in developing unit tests with assertions for core functionality. Self-starter and reliable team player with ability to deliver projects on-time. Strong ability to thrive in a high-intensity, rapidly changing environment. Ability to successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously with a sense of urgency. Preferred Experience with Service Cloud and (Experience Cloud a big plus). Experience with deployment tools (Flosum a plus). 1+ year experience with Agile Methodology. Experience at SaaS company.  Beneficios  Remote culture. Bonus Two times in the year September 18th and December 25th. 10% of the monthly salary if the employee has less than one year in the company. 15% of the monthly salary when the employee has been in the company for more than one year. Paid Leave days. We founded Variacode to support the accelerated growth of our clients' businesses, we are quality-oriented, driven by agile methodologies, and passion for technology. We are a company specialized in DevOPS, automation, software architecture, software development, consultancy services, and we love what we do.

Title: Cryptography and Security Engineer - Freelance [Remote]
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: ABOUT US : Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn. ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS: When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process. JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below) LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (TimeZone: CST | Partial overlap) HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $65 – $75/hr ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6710 THE OPPORTUNITY Qualifications 5+ years of proven experience in Cryptography  Bachelor's, Master's, or related degree in Computer Science, Cryptography, Mathematics, or a related field Knowledge and experience in enterprise architecture frameworks  Strong knowledge of cryptography (AES, hashing, one-time pad, etc.) offerings  Hands on experience working with private and public keys, network and application encryption, mobile device, MFA, on prem and cloud encryption methods and protection Strong experience working with hardware or IOT Devices  Demonstrated working experience in remote globally-distributed environment  Experience within the biometric industry, helpful    What you’ll be working on Summary And Skills Our client is looking for a highly experienced Cryptography and Security Engineer to join their team to help us continue to evolve the biometric capture systems that provide the foundation for biometric authentication within the company's network. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and analyzing cryptographic algorithms and systems to ensure the secure communication, authentication, and integrity of sensitive data. You will be working with their Security Manager, Biometric team, and hardware teams towards the development of secure and robust cryptographic solutions that protect sensitive information and ensure the privacy and security of our client's organization and its stakeholders. Responsibilities Design and develop cryptographic algorithms, protocols, and systems to provide secure communication, authentication, data integrity, and non-repudiation.  Contribute to the development and maintenance of cryptographic standards, policies, and procedures.  Align our client’s security goals with security standards frameworks: SOC2, NIST - CSF, ISO 27001, CSA CCM, PCI-DSS, GDPR  Work closely with the Security Manager to set best practices, protocols, and methodologies consistent with cryptographic industry standards  Assess upcoming SLAs and design future proof solutions for deployments  Collaborate with computer vision engineers, infrastructure engineers, CPO, and biometric teams to integrate cryptographic mechanisms into products and services. Hands on experience working with private and public key cryptography  Maintain regular risk mitigation and governance practices associated with cryptography Apply Now! C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application. Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Ruby On Rails)
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Description At EPAM we strive to create the best web applications with the highest level of performance and availability in the world. In this role, you’ll be a part of a team that’s creating best-in-class microservices and perform back-end development to ensure that every client facing solution we create perform above expectations. Req.#306915225 What You’ll Do Design and develop particular features or non-functional requirements (coding, configuring existing functionality, re-factoring, etc.) based on business requirements and architecture adhering to the software quality requirements Develop unit and integration tests Manually test developed solutions when it is necessary Document produced code Develop fixes for defects found by internal or customer QA Conduct re-factorings and continuous code improvement What You Have +5 years of practical experience in programming technologies and software development life cycle (SDLC) Mastery in Ruby on Rails Experience in HTML/CSS Markup Understand business requirements and customer needs EmberJS Development Skills Knowledge of jQuery Be proficient in written and spoken English (at least B2 level) Benefits Improved medical coverage - EPAMers are eligible to participate in a supplementary health insurance program that shall have the usual coverage in the industry, with the Company funding 100% of the value of the monthly premium for participation Lunch Allowance - You will receive a daily allowance of CLP $ 7.000 per working day. Enjoy a nice meal on us Allowance for internet and electricity - You will receive an allowance of CLP$15.000 per month to cover internet and electricity expenses National Holiday Bonus - We celebrate joining the Chilean Market. That is why all our employees will receive a bonus of CLP $86,646 in September Christmas Bonus - You will receive an End of Year bonus of CLP $170,539. It will be paid during the month of December, to ensure you have a Happy Holiday! Learning Culture - We want you to be the best version of yourself, that is why we offer unlimited access to learning platforms, a wide range of internal courses, and all the knowledge you need to grow professionally Additional Income - Besides your regular salary, you will also have the chance to earn extra income by referring talent, being a technical interviewer, and many more ways Are you open to relocation? - If you want to relocate to another country and we have the right project, we will assist you every step of the way, to help you and your family, reach your new home We offer We trust our people. We believe in team distribution and that you know what you are doing, which is why you will be able to work remotely and have a flexible schedule We are both proud of working within a diverse and inclusive environment and acting in our role as an equal opportunities’ employer. You are welcome at EPAM for who you are You will be challenged while working side-by side with the best talent globally. We work with top-notch technologies, constantly seeking out new industry trends and best practices We are a global design community eager to share knowledge, experiences, and mentoring. You will learn, contribute, and grow with us How does it sound to know you can have a 20+year career with us constantly growing and without the need to look elsewhere? We offer access to learning platforms, classes, and workshops to support your development. You will be set up for success with our clear career paths and support in helping you achieve the goals you set for yourself, both personal and professional We seek improvement in a proactive manner. You have the freedom to make recommendations, suggestions or simply comment on things without the pressure of adhering to hierarchy or strict processes We work with a broad range of clients: Media, Entertainment, Life Sciences, Automotive, Finance, Technology, and Travel. You will play a key role in growing their business and potentially work in multiple new industries About EPAM EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential   Apply

Title: Senior Java Developer
Ciudad: Providencia, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.   Equifax is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to design and develop dynamic and scalable solutions within our Data Fabric team. You will be working on a Big Data processing project running on Google Cloud using technologies like Java SpringBoot Microservices, Cloud DataFlow (Apache Beam), PubSub and Kubernetes.     What you’ll do     Develop strategic design and requirements on small systems or modules of large systems.   Translating functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design   As part of a community, you’ll participate in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standards   Work with tech lead, product owners and other business partners to define work for the team   Participates in the estimation process, use case specifications, reviews of test plans and test cases, requirements, and project planning.   Perform general application development activities, including unit testing, code deployment to development environment and technical documentation.   Recognize that all delivered software must be secure and ensure proper controls are incorporated in each step of the SDLC.   Guide and mentor junior developers in developing code and workflow procedures, and conduct code reviews.  What Experience You Need  5+ years of Java (8 and above) software development experience including Spring framework 5.x, and SpringBoot   3+ years of experience with Maven or Gradle build management, Git   3+ years of experience working with Relational and/or NoSQL databases   3+ years of microservice application development and deploying using containerization technologies like Docker (preferably using Spring Boot)   3+ years of experience Web service development, resource-oriented architecture, RESTful web services experience   3+ years of experience Unit and automation testing (Jasmine, JUnit, Cucumber)   3+ years of experience with one of the Public Cloud technologies: Google, AWS , Azure       What could set you apart     Hands-on experience with a Big Data project using technologies like Apache Beam or Spark   Experience mentoring other engineers and defining the technical culture of the team   Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform   Experience with cloud container orchestration solutions like Kubernetes and associated frameworks like Helm charts  We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, paid time off, and potential for organizational growth through our online learning platform, with guided career paths. Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference! Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability.

Title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (C#)
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: WE ARE SoftServe is a global digital solutions company headquartered in Austin, Texas, founded in 1993. 13,000+ associates are working on 1,100+ projects with clients in the USA, Europe, and APAC region. Our client is one of the world’s largest restaurant companies. Our client is building out a strong development team to help them deliver a brand new omnichannel Node.js microservice-based eCommerce Platform for 50,000+ restaurants all around the world. That’s a huge responsibility, and that is why our client is on a mission to find the most fearless engineer to join their software team. Client's dynamic eCommerce Platform team is rapidly growing as they optimize their digital ordering channels and technology innovations to create competitive advantages for their restaurants around the globe. We are seeking a Full-stack Engineer to make a monumental impact on their stack. While this is a Back End position, there is an opportunity for a Full Stack contribution. YOU ARE Possessing 3-5 years of Azure Full Stack development A holder of profound experience in functions, microservices, pub/sub architecture designs (service bus), and API/Webhook usability Having background in ARM templates, Swagger Docs Showing .NET Core and Azure .NET proficiency, whereas .NET 6 will make you stand out Working with Azure DevOps, Git repos, and pipeline experience Showing extra advantages in PowerShell scripting Docker containers Edge services YOU WANT TO WORK WITH Participating in the full Scrum life cycle with the team Collaborative design and building of customer-facing software products Analyzing, designing, programming, debugging, and modifying software enhancements and new products Product Owners and Business Analysts to understand requirements and refine technical user stories Participating in software design meetings and analyzing the client's needs to determine technical requirements Building effective, clean, well-tested, and scalable solutions across the platform Troubleshooting application and system issues TOGETHER WE WILL Help our client to build software to serve people in new ways to make team members more productive and customers happier Work in a very collaborative environment Care about your individual initiatives — we are open to them, just come and share your ideas Support your technical and personal growth — we have a dedicated career plan for all roles in our company   SoftServe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, veteran status, and other protected characteristics under applicable law. Let’s put your talents and experience in motion with SoftServe

Title: Data Infrastructure Engineer - Remote - Latin America
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential. We’re most proud of: Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users. Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor. Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average. The Position: We're looking to hire one Data Infrastructure Engineer to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways: Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis. Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients. What We're Looking For: As a Data Infrastructure Engineer, you will be responsible for building, configuring, maintaining, and monitoring our data infrastructure, while utilizing various technologies. 5+ years of experience in building and maintaining large-scale data infrastructure, with a focus on machine learning, data pipelines, orchestration, and real-time streaming Meaningful experience with AWS cloud infrastructure and related services, such as S3, EC2, EMR, and Lambda. Experience with real-time data streaming technologies such as Apache Kafka, and MSK or DMS. Meaningful experience with Docker or Kubernetes. Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases, such as MySQL, Postgres, and MongoDB. Meaningful experience with Snowflake.  Advanced English is required. A four-year college degree is required. Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon. Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them. An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them. Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed. A positive mindset and can-do attitude. Forensic attention to detail. Benefits: Competitive pay in your local currency. 100% remote work. The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies. English Classes. Virtual company events each month. Ample opportunity for career advancement. Continuing education opportunities. Depending on your location other benefits may apply. FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process. Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice .

Title: Principal Software Engineer, Growth
Ciudad: Área metropolitana de Santiago
Descripcion: This role is primarily for remote engineers located in LATAM.   Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more. The Role Our client is seeking a Principle Software Engineer with a focus on financial data aggregation. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring our client reliably aggregates, enriches, and analyzes our users' financial data from various sources and at a large scale. This is a problem that is ripe for innovation, requiring technical excellence, creative problem solving, world-class product intuition, comfort with large volumes of data, and the ability to work with internal and external APIs.  Your Contribution  Our client is seeking a Principle Software Engineer with a focus on growth and activation. In this role, you will be responsible for technical and product changes that help with new user acquisition, onboarding, and activation. This is a dynamic role, requiring a mix of technical prowess, product intuition, strategic thinking, customer empathy, and comfort with business and product metrics. We are flexible on seniority for this role. Ideally, you have 5+ years of experience, but the role is flexible.  The Role   As the first Growth Engineer, you will lead the technical efforts to acquire and onboard users, and convert them to paying subscribers.   You will collaborate with company leadership, and cross-functionally with the Product, Marketing, Design, and Data Science teams.   You will analyze data and user behavior to identify trends, pain points, and ideas for opportunities to improve the initial user experience.   You're comfortable doing deep technical / product work (eg building new features, etc) as well as identifying low-hanging fruit that can improve user experience and key metrics.  Skills  You are a technically-proficient generalist, able to work on front-end, back-end, or integrations with external APIs.   You can work with Python and/or Typescript (or are willing/able to learn).   You are a strong systems thinker, and are familiar with product/growth funnels.   You are comfortable with funnel, conversion, and engagement metrics, including multivariate testing.   You have excellent product intuition, and are comfortable with both qualitative and quantitative data.   You love to move the needle on core business metrics, though both quick experiments and longer-term initiatives.   [Optional] You have worked on growth, onboarding, and activation for consumer products at scale.  Salary Range: $70,000 - $130,000

Title: Ingeniero Almacenamiento y Recuperación de Datos (TI)
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Company Description: Perceptual Consultores Ltda. Job Description: Estamos en búsqueda de profesional Senior, 10 años de experiencia, para el cargo de Especialista Backup and Storage en importante empresa líder en Servicios Digitales y Consultoría de Próxima Generación. ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones? -Actuar como punto de escalamiento de segundo nivel para todos los problemas generales de almacenamiento y funcionalidad. -Dominio del incidente y trabajar con L3 y otros equipos para resolver completamente los problemas y documentar los procedimientos. -Revisar todos los incidentes, problemas, cambios en el seguimiento del almacenamiento y asegúrese de que se cumplan todos los SLA / KPI. -EMC VMAX, VNX, Unity, XTREMIO, VPLEX, Administración y soporte puros. -Experiencia en tecnologías de backup como Commvault, Avamar, DatDomain. -Administración y soporte de NETAPP FAS y E-series. -Sólidas habilidades de solución de problemas en el entorno de almacenamiento. -Sólido conocimiento práctico de las tecnologías de almacenamiento (es decir, SAN, NAS, iSCSI, canal de fibra, arreglos de discos de almacenamiento empresarial, replicación de datos, HSM). -Administración y soporte de HP 3PAR. -Administración de almacenamiento en múltiples entornos VMWARE y Unix, hardware y sistemas operativos. Fuertes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración. -Experiencia en switches Cisco MDS y Brocade. -Creación de plantillas a partir de máquinas virtuales, implementación de máquinas virtuales a partir de plantillas y asignación de recursos. -La experiencia en plataformas de sistemas operativos Windows / VMware / Linux será una ventaja adicional. Modalidad: Presencial en Santiago. Horario: Sistema de turnos 7x7, de 12 hrs., de 8:00 a 20:00 hrs. (diurno) y de 20:00 a 08:00 (nocturno). Trabajan 7 días en turno de día, descansan 7 días; trabajan 7 días turno noche, descansan 7 días, y así sucesivamente. Requisitos minimos: -Profesional Senior, 10 años de experiencia. -Calificación terciaria en TI / Ciencias de la Computación / disciplina relacionada. -Disposición para trabajar en operaciones 24/7 -Inglés intermedio-avanzado. Habilidades adicionales: -Excelentes habilidades de interfaz con el cliente. -Excelentes habilidades de comunicación escrita y verbal. -Gran atención al detalle y excelentes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.

Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Our client is an elite group of San Francisco-based developers and product retailers who have created software used by millions of people around the world. The client works with the best brands from the Silicon Valley, offering solutions that require technological and architectural excellence. The company is made up of people who have worked for brands such as Apple, Google, Amazon. The client focuses on talents and emphasizes that he created unicorns, invested in unicorns and thanks to this he is a mentor to the most ambitious and talented programmers around the world. Your Role In The Team Your Role will be designing, building and managing infrastructure and solving problems related to processing and analysis. Level Of Knowledge And Qualifications Minimum 5 years of Python experience Experience working with data pipelines such as Airflow Extensive experience with SQL Good business level English Nice To Have Experience in data engineering technologies like Kafka Experience working in marketing, e-commerce, or ad-tech Experience working with cloud infrastructure such as Google Cloud Platform, Azure, or AWS What Do You Get 100% remote work B2B employment 15 days of paid vacation and 10 days PTO Flexible working hours Language courses Referral program Free access to paid investment channels – Seeking Alpha, Motley Fool SPVs investments – special investment opportunities Parental leave Recruitment Proces Telephone conversation with KZ INSPIRE recruiter (15 minutes). Soft skills interview. Technical interview with a technical leader. CEO interview. Two technical interviews with the client.

Title: Technical Lead, Software Engineering (MERN)
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: About Q4 At Q4, we hustle, we grind and we grow. As the team members that make up #Q4orce, we care, we compete and we support each other every day. We’re on a mission to deliver a best-in-class client experience that is driven by technology, data, and of course, our people. Q4 is the leading capital markets access platform that is transforming how issuers, investors, and the sell-side efficiently connect, communicate, and engage with each other. We are a trusted partner to more than 2,650 public companies globally, including many of the most respected brands in the world, and we maintain an award winning culture where our team members grow and thrive. We are on our way to becoming the largest and most trusted, Investor relations platform company in the world. We hire smart, curious, and talented people to push boundaries, reimagine what’s possible, and turn challenges into opportunities. All while keeping the needs of our clients at the heart of everything we do. Come grow with us! The Gig. Lead the development of major software components, systems, and features. Leverage your expertise in Software Development to mentor and coach the team to raise the overall output of the development team. Contribute to system design and architecture. Key Responsibilities: Designing, building and maintaining architecturally sound solutions that deliver measurable results Maintaining a high level of quality across all of your work Ensuring that software developed by you is adequately documented Providing technical leadership and guidance to all developers  Having an impact on a culture of creativity and risk-taking by doing both Ensuring Q4 Architecture process is followed in squads assigned to the tech lead Participate effectively in rituals and ceremonies including architecture meetings Required Experience: 5+ years of Software Engineering Experience in JavaScript, and other modern web application languages Experience with Relational and NoSQL databases. Experience developing large-scale production web application systems across the full stack Experience in both technical planning and implementation-level software design A desire to remain technically capable and an expert in current technologies Proven track record of practical, thoughtful problem solving Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills for technical audiences Why Q4? We are motivated by solving complex problems in unorthodox ways. Emphasis on your well-being means you experience your true potential. We offer a variety of benefits to ensure you can always work hard and have fun:  Health, wellness & lifestyle benefits to balance your heart, mind, and body;  Pension matching and Employee Equity Incentives to support your financial health;  Unlimited paid time off so you can truly recharge and enjoy life;  Choose your home, one of our trendy offices, or mix it up with our flexible working environment;  Virtual team building and socials, keeping people connected is important to us; and  A fantastic culture to top it all off! Join #Q4orce Q4’s diverse and inclusive workplace fosters a friendly, open-minded environment. Diversity makes us stronger from the increased pace of innovation to strengthening our culture. With great reasons to work here, take advantage by submitting your application to join our growing team. Q4 values diversity and people of all backgrounds and abilities. Should you require any accommodations prior to or during the interview process, please contact hr@q4inc.com . #q4orce

Title: Golang/C Software Engineer - Backing store for MicroK8s
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: We are hiring a software developer to focus on MicroK8s' backing store, a specialized distributed database designed on top of dqlite, Canonical's distributed SQL database. As a member of the Kubernetes team, you will design and implement features and enhancements to the backing store, become a dqlite specialist and optimize its use in the context of Kubernetes. You will gain familiarity with the latest features in Kubernetes and look to incorporate the best of open-source for our end-users. You will collaborate with industry peers and partners to bring the right solutions to our customers This is an exciting opportunity for a Software Engineer passionate about open source, Linux, C, Golang, SQLite and Kubernetes. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu. What you'll do Design and develop features and enhancements to MicroK8s' backing store Optimize MicroK8s' backing store performance Identify and describe potential feature requests for dqlite  Engage with the open source community and commercial partners Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events Who you are You have C/Golang programming experience You have experience with key/value and SQL databases You have experience with Kubernetes You have strong written and verbal communication skills You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree Experience with consensus algorithms (preferably with Raft) is a plus Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration. #Stack

Title: Linux Cryptography and Security Engineer
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: This is a unique opportunity to use your cryptography and certification skills to enable Ubuntu and its users to operate securely and to remain compliant to FIPS 140 and Common Criteria standards. You will use your applied cryptography, Linux Security, and coding skills to enhance the Ubuntu distribution and work with DISA and CIS to help draft Ubuntu STIGs and Ubuntu CIS benchmarks. You will work with and support the team to develop automation tooling for making Ubuntu systems STIG and CIS benchmark compliant and audit the systems for compliance. You will work with the team to achieve new compliance and certifications for Ubuntu as needed. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on direction and execution. The successful candidate will collaborate with Canonical's kernel and security teams to extend and enhance the Ubuntu distribution with the features necessary to achieve and retain FIPS and CC certification. What You'll Do Support the Security Certifications engineers to achieve and retain various Security certifications Extend and enhance Linux cryptographic components - specifically with modules such as OpenSSL/Libgcrypt - with the features and functionality required for FIPS and CC certification Collaborate with external security consultants to test and validate kernel and crypto components, achieve and retain FIPS and CC certification Work with external partners to develop CIS benchmarks and hardening automation for Ubuntu Contribute to Ubuntu mainline and upstream projects to land solutions and benefit the community Communication and collaboration within and outside Canonical to rapidly resolve issues and keep the project on track Who You Are Knowledge of and familiarity with low-level Linux cryptography APIs and debugging Significant experience working with open source libraries Experience working with Linux Kernel Knowledge of security benchmarks such as STIG and CIS benchmarks.  Security Certification experience and knowledge in FIPS and/or CC Experience with OVAL (Open Vulnerability Assessment Language) and Go We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Ingeniero Preventa TI, VMware, Cloud
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Company Description: Xinerlink Job Description: Importante empresa de Telecomunicaciones requiere profesional para diseñar y preparar propuestas eficientes para proyectos. Funciones: Participar en reuniones de forma activa en reunión con clientes para generar levantamiento de requerimientos y necesidades. Generación de reuniones con clientes presentando la oferta de productos TI con el objetivo de masificar el conocimiento y explorar nuevas oportunidades. Evaluar proyectos desde el punto de vista técnico y económico. Diseño de soluciones altamente eficientes y económicamente competitivas. Unificar criterios técnicos respecto a diseños para soluciones a la medida con áreas técnicas. Interactuar con la Gerencia de productos incentivando y retroalimentando con el fin de crear una mejora continua. Apoyo en el proceso de gestión de conocimiento para las áreas comerciales. Requisitos: Título profesional en áreas técnicas de la ingeniería. Experiencia mínima de 2 años en preventa de servicios TI. Conocimiento en diseño de soluciones VMware (ESX, vCloud), etc. Conocimientos deseables en MS Azure y AWS Google Cloud. Conocimientos deseables en solución de TD (BI, IA, UX, IOT, DataScient. Deseable certificación VCP o acreditaciones VTSP o VSP. Deseable certificación Microsoft Conocimientos generales en SAP/ SAP Hana, base de datos Oracle. Conocimientos de HW en distintos fabricantes y vendedores. Habilidades para exponer o presentar propuestas y la oferta de productos y servicios. Ideal inglés intermedio – avanzado. IMPORTANTE, el currículo debe detallar expresamente en cada una de las experiencias laborales, las funciones del cargo, el rol dentro de la empresa, si realizo análisis, desarrollo, levantamientos, etc. Es vital incluir las metodologías utilizadas, lenguajes, versiones, frameworks, tipo de base de datos, fecha de inicio y término de todos los proyectos (mes y año).

Title: Sr Data Engineer

The world’s leading content creators, broadcasters, OTTs and distributors rely onour customer’s experience and expertise. Descripcion: Experience Remote done Right . Title: Systems Engineer

Descripcion: Job Description Job Duties and Responsibilities Pre-sales - assist in qualifying sales leads from a technical standpoint. Sales calls - be the main technical resource on sales calls and answer/ educate the customer on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration. Lead scoping sessions with customers and partners. Understand customer needs and potential constraints (e.g., budget or timeline) and propose suitable solutions. Provide assistance to identified customers with post-sales training. Post-sales - be the lead technical contact for identified accounts for technical issues and will work closely with the technical support team and engineering to answer, elevate and resolve customer's technical issues. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. Graduate degree preferred. Certifications: CCIE, CISSP Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience or equivalent work experience. Experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineer Experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration or deployment Experience with Wireless technologies Strong understanding of authentication technologies Strong understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, WLAN, SD-WAN Network Security, Intrusion Detection, Antivirus, EDR. Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Strong presentation skills Teamwork skills Fluent in English Fortinet has been built on diversity. Our company is a diverse workplace resulting from an integrated team with true international representation and contributors with a variety of talents, backgrounds, experiences, and approaches. We have an equal and transparent selection process, you will be considered regardless of gender, race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, or disability. In fact, if you have any disability that requires for us to do any accommodation, please contact us at accommadations@fortinet.com . Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Title: SSR DevOps Engineer (Ref: 1054)

Descripcion: Me contacto contigo ya que nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un SSR DevOps Engineer (Ref. # 1054) para unirse a nuestro equipo y trabajar junto a nuestro cliente LA ARAUCANA. Somos un equipo apasionado por la tecnología, la innovación y la investigación. En Vates nos entusiasma ofrecer servicios de desarrollo de software a medida de primer nivel. Contamos con 30 años de experiencia brindando servicios y soluciones de IT a grandes empresas en USA y LATAM. Guiamos la transformación exponencial y digital de algunas de las principales empresas del mundo, como Motorola, Intel, IBM, Oracle, etc. Vates es reconocida por Clutch.co como una de las mejores empresas de IoT. Con nosotros trabajarás junto a los líderes del sector en proyectos de vanguardia en un entorno innovador y ágil. Nuestros profesionales forman parte del 10% de los mejores talentos de IT. En Vates participarás en diferentes proyectos formados por equipos multiculturales distribuidos en diferentes partes del mundo. Buscamos líderes proactivos, orientados al trabajo en equipo, apasionados por la programación y que busquen ofrecer la mejor experiencia al usuario final. Esta es una excelente oportunidad si buscas desarrollarte en una empresa que está creciendo exponencialmente en el sector. Principales Desafíos y Responsabilidades Del Puesto Diseñar, implementar y mantener pipelines de integración y delivery continuo (CI/CD) desplegados en Gitlab. Crear, desplegar y mantener infraestructura como código con Terraform, teniendo en cuenta la alta disponibilidad, costo y seguridad. Administración de Kubernetes para microservicios deployados en contenedores. Implementar monitoreo de infraestructura y servicios ocupando herramienta Google Cloud's operations suite. Lugar de trabajo:  Modalidad híbrida: on site (2 veces por semana) / remoto desde Chile (3 veces por semana) Horario de trabajo:  Lunes a viernes 9 a 18hs (Chile) En Vates te ofrecemos:  Excelente plan de compensación Crecimiento y desarrollo constante debido a nuestra expansión Si la propuesta es de tu interés, te pido que me envíes tu CV actualizado junto con tus pretensiones salariales. Debajo te comparto el link con un video institucional, para que conozcas más sobre Vates https://youtu.be/JL8I6ZHSY2s Aguardo tu respuesta. ¡Saludos y gracias! Requisitos mínimos Principales Requerimientos Experiencia con cloud GCP Experiencia con alguna herramienta de CI/CD como Gitlab Experiencia con Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) Experiencia trabajando con herramienta de IaC como Terraform Conocimientos básicos sobre redes (VPC, LB, NAT, etc) Fluidez en algún lenguaje de programación como NodeJs, TypeScript, JavaScript u otro Experiencia administrando cluster(s) de Kubernetes (GKE) Manejo fluido de Git (Branching, rebase, resolución de conflictos)

Title: Functional Developer (Configurador)
Ciudad: Las Condes, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: **Cette description est disponible en anglais seulement** Equisoft, a leading global provider of digital business solutions for the insurance and wealth industries, is actively seeking new talent! The Functional Developer works closely with a team consisting of a project manager, a business analyst, a team lead, developers and quality assurance specialists. In this role, you will develop superior analytical skills, insurance industry expertise, will gain valuable programming concepts and will become familiar with relational databases. You live in Colombia, México or Chile and have what it takes to work at Equisoft? Send us your resume, because Equisoft is open to teleworking! Do you want to meet your colleagues and socialize? It's also possible because Equisoft also has beautiful offices in Philadelphia, Cape Town, Montréal and Québec City!  A DAY IN YOUR LIFE   Perform configuration development and release management for the Oracle Insurance Policy Administration (OIPA) system   Maintain and grow insurance industry and technical knowledge competencies   Collaborate with configuration team, technical team and business analysts to ensure OIPA system is configured to achieve the system behavior defined by the business requirements   Participate in self-directed learning - specifically in configuration syntax and Insurance Business Knowledge   Analyze and resolve basic problems to maintain data integrity, process integrity, and system performance   Work in a client service context, involving client interactions at various levels   MUST-HAVES   Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Actuarial studies; and/or equivalent job experience   Strong analytical thinking, organizational and problem-solving skills   Strong mathematical skills and attention to detail   Familiarity with XML, SQL and relational/entity databases, and MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, and Visio)   Understanding of system design and development processes   Strong English written and oral communication skills   Ability to deliver high-quality projects on time and within scope   Positive attitude with the ability to work in an ever-changing environment   Inquisitive and proactive approach with an ability to work independently and a desire to continuously learn new skills and technologies;   Ability to take initiative and be a solution seeker   Ability to thrive in a team environment and develop excellent relationships with others   NICE-TO-HAVES  1-3 years of experience working with the OIPA platform and/or equivalent job experience   Knowledge of computer system capabilities, business processes and workflow   Some exposure to SDLC (Waterfall, Agile, etc.)   Product knowledge of insurance and/or annuity products   Knowledge of software testing best practices  Your Benefits  Competitive compensation   Comprehensive benefits packages   Flexible work schedules & collaborative workspaces   Commuter benefits   Career development   International assignments   Various social and team activities  Click here to view all career opportunities. We thank you for your interest in our company and we guarantee that all submitted applications will be considered. Only those whose applications are selected will be contacted for interview purposes. By submitting your application, you consent to Equisoft collecting, using & storing your personal data in order to apply for a job and for Equisoft to analyze your application. Due to the nature of its products and services, Equisoft will perform thorough background checks prior to confirming one’s employment.
