Title: Azure Systems Engineer
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Description EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multicultural teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential. You are curious, persistent, logical, and clever — a true techie at heart. You enjoy living by the code of your craft and developing elegant solutions for complex problems. If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as an  Azure Systems Engineer . Scroll down to learn more about the position’s responsibilities and requirements.  OUR VALUE, OUR PEOPLE We aim to deliver truly transformative solutions around the world, with top-notch technologies, in high-performance professional teams. But none of these would be possible without our people, and that’s where you come in.   As an EPAMer you will always be expanding your knowledge, facing, and addressing the biggest challenges, and becoming the best version of yourself, both personally and professionally. We care about your development and to support your growth in the company, there are many career paths you can follow. One of the positions you can grow into is  Senior Systems Engineer , among others. #REF_HOU_CL What You’ll Do Actively participate in the decision-making process regarding infrastructure architecture for both internal projects and EPAM’s customers Conduct tools and practices research, evaluation, proof of concept, and training for internal and external customers Design, implement and maintain GitOps cycles based on Immutable Infrastructure Develop and maintain Continuous Deployment processes, tools, and execution; includes test frameworks, static code analysis, promotion gateways, etc Design, develop, and support Configuration Management as Code, tools, and execution for internal projects or EPAM’s clients’ projects Design, implement, and promote the non-functional tests automation for products EPAM develops for its customers Seek quality and resource optimization to improve the product and the team's value stream What You Have Solid Linux Sys Admin background Strong experience with Azure Cloud / Certification on Azure Fundamentals Knowledge and experience with Infrastructure as Code, Configuration Management, Observability (design and implementation), CI/CD pipelines and Containerization / Clusterization Experience with version control Git Experience with documenting procedures Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to interact with external customers and staff members Ability to work in a fast paced, constantly expanding environment English proficiency (B1+) Benefits Improved medical coverage - EPAMers are eligible to participate in a supplementary health insurance program that shall have the usual coverage in the industry, with the Company funding 100% of the value of the monthly premium for participation Lunch Allowance - You will receive a daily allowance of CLP $ 7.000 per working day. Enjoy a nice meal on us Allowance for internet and electricity - You will receive an allowance of CLP$15.000 per month to cover internet and electricity expenses National Holiday Bonus - We celebrate joining the Chilean Market. That is why all our employees will receive a bonus of CLP $86,646 in September Christmas Bonus - You will receive an End of Year bonus of CLP $170,539. It will be paid during the month of December, to ensure you have a Happy Holiday! Learning Culture - We want you to be the best version of yourself, that is why we offer unlimited access to learning platforms, a wide range of internal courses, and all the knowledge you need to grow professionally Additional Income - Besides your regular salary, you will also have the chance to earn extra income by referring talent, being a technical interviewer, and many more ways Are you open to relocation? - If you want to relocate to another country and we have the right project, we will assist you every step of the way, to help you and your family, reach your new home We offer We trust our people. We believe in team distribution and that you know what you are doing, which is why you will be able to work remotely and have a flexible schedule We are both proud of working within a diverse and inclusive environment and acting in our role as an equal opportunities’ employer. You are welcome at EPAM for who you are You will be challenged while working side-by side with the best talent globally. We work with top-notch technologies, constantly seeking out new industry trends and best practices We are a global design community eager to share knowledge, experiences, and mentoring. You will learn, contribute, and grow with us How does it sound to know you can have a 20+year career with us constantly growing and without the need to look elsewhere? We offer access to learning platforms, classes, and workshops to support your development. You will be set up for success with our clear career paths and support in helping you achieve the goals you set for yourself, both personal and professional We seek improvement in a proactive manner. You have the freedom to make recommendations, suggestions or simply comment on things without the pressure of adhering to hierarchy or strict processes We work with a broad range of clients: Media, Entertainment, Life Sciences, Automotive, Finance, Technology, and Travel. You will play a key role in growing their business and potentially work in multiple new industries   Apply

Title: Desarrollador(a) PHP
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Fidelizador, empresa chilena de servicios en marketing en la nube (cloud) con 15 años en el mercado, especializada en la comunicación masiva a través de canales digitales, busca integrar a su equipo un profesional para el cargo de Ingeniero de Software, quien tendrá la responsabilidad de mantener y desarrollar los nuevos productos de software de la compañía.  Funciones del cargo Buscamos  dos talentos  con aprecio por el desarrollo de software, para que se incorporen al  mantenimiento ,  optimización  y  desarrollo  de nuestro sistema, el cual está desarrollado principalmente en  Symfony  y  Python . Deberán desarrollar e implementar diferentes funcionalidades y contar con capacidad para analizar, entender y resolver problemas. Somos un  equipo diverso, dinámico y colaborativo , en el cual las opiniones, ideas y la comunicación son claves para avanzar. Siempre bajo un grato y fluido ambiente. Buscamos a talentos de Santiago , pero  también de otras regiones.  Por el momento, nuestro trabajo es remoto, pero cuando la situación país lo permita esto podría cambiar. Si no vives en Santiago o en Chile, no hay problema, podemos gestionar esto y solo tendríamos que coordinar algunas visitas esporádicas a la oficina.  Te invitamos a postular  si sientes que cumples con los requisitos y sobretodo si te motiva trabajar en Fidelizador.  ¿Qué esperamos de ti? Esperamos  poseas estudios de Ingeniería en Informática o similares , junto a que te sientas cómoda/o  planificando y ejecutando proyectos de ingeniería de software . Esperamos poseas capacidad de  auto-gestión ,  trabajo en equipo  y que estés dispuesto a  trabajar bajo un ambiente de aprendizaje continuo . Buscamos seas capaz de  expresar tus ideas, inquietudes, aportes y dudas al equipo  siempre con  respeto  al entorno. También, buscamos poseas experiencia y conocimiento en  PHP, POO  y  MVC . Experiencia en algún F ramework PHP , en  HTML 5, CSS, Javascript, BBDD (Mysql, MariaDB,…) , conocimientos de  Python , uso de plataformas  Linux . Conocimientos de API  REST. Por último, esperamos tengas experiencia trabajando con SCV,  GIT  o similar.  Conocimientos deseables que ¡suman puntos! Experiencia con Symfony 2 o superior Experiencia con Python Experiencia con Bootstrap 3 o superior Conocimientos de Gulp, Bower, jQuery Conocimientos protocolo SMTP Experiencia con Pruebas Unitarias Experiencia y/o conocimiento con Desarrollo Ágil Conocimientos y experiencia con Integración Continua  ¿Qué ofrecemos? Te ofrecemos formar parte del equipo de Fidelizador.com, empresa de tecnología con proyección de crecimiento internacional y ser parte de un equipo motivado y profesional. Tendrás acceso a beneficios como aguinaldos para fiestas patrias y navidad, seguro complementario de salud y Caja de compensación Los Andes. Realizamos continuamente actividades de esparcimiento. Nuestra oficina tiene estacionamiento de bicicletas. Tenemos buenas sillas, buen café de grano y un Playstation que usamos cada vez que organizamos torneos. Ofrecemos un contrato plazo fijo de 1 mes, luego 2 meses; posterior a esto, el contrato es indefinido. La jornada es de 40 horas semanales, de lunes a viernes.

Title: Senior iOS Engineer - LATAM
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: We are Rad Hires, a premier staffing and recruiting company with close to 10 years of experience placing software engineers in South America with US companies. We are headquartered in New York, NY with a growing team and have clients in the US consisting of startups, enterprises, and digital agencies. We are seeking an experienced Contract iOS Engineer - LATAM to join our growing engineering team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and troubleshooting iOS applications. The ideal candidate should have a strong Swift, SwiftUI, and iOS development background. Responsibilities Develop, maintain, and troubleshoot iOS applications. Design and develop user interfaces, features, and components for iOS applications. Collaborate with other engineers, designers, and product owners to ensure high-quality product development. Create and maintain technical documentation. Develop and execute unit tests. Implement and adhere to software development best practices. Collaborate with other teams, such as operations and customer support, to deploy iOS applications. Maintain and improve the performance of iOS applications. Debug and resolve issues related to iOS applications. Identify and address usability issues in iOS applications. Keep up-to-date with industry trends and advances in mobile technology. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 5+ years of experience with iOS development. Proficient in Swift and SwiftUI. Experience with CocoaPods and other third-party libraries. Knowledge of mobile app design principles. Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills. Experience with RESTful APIs and web services. Experience with version control systems such as git. Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Excellent written and verbal English communication skills We Offer Fully remote Long-term/Short-term Full-time/Part-time No timezone shifting Compensation in US Dollars If you have the skills and experience required for this position and are excited to work with us, we invite you to apply. We look forward to hearing from you. Please no agencies or C2C.

Title: Senior Javascript Full Stack Engineer - Remote
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Clevertech is looking for a Sr. Full Stack Javascript Engineer to join our global team. In this role you will have significant responsibility in one of our project development teams to ensure client satisfaction by executing on the deliverables. Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals. REQUIREMENTS  7+ years of professional experience (A technical assessment will be required)  Senior-level experience of at least 4 years of experience in the front-end (React) and back-end (Node, Express, Mongo, SQL) Ability to create clean, modern, testable, well-documented code Advanced English fluency, verbal and written Professional, empathic, team player Problem solver, proactive, go-getter BENEFITS Own Your Time We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting. Recharge Time We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh. Care For Yourself You’ll receive a health/wellness stipend that can go towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym! Focused Work You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. Learn at your edges We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. Clevertech Swag And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack. Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers. Clevertech Culture Video

Title: Desarrollador de SW 4
Ciudad: Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Id de solicitud de puesto: 59847 Vive la experiencia SONDA  ¡Aquí transformas tu carrera! ¿Por qué ser parte de SONDA? Porque al igual que tú, amamos lo que hacemos, tenemos pasión por la innovación y estamos convencidos de que a través del conocimiento y de la tecnología no solo vamos a transformar los negocios de nuestros clientes, sino también el futuro. En SONDA vivirás una experiencia de trabajo con diversas oportunidades de desarrollo personal y profesional. Un excelente lugar para aprender y contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas por medio de la tecnología. Buscamos a que quieran aprender y transformar su carrera. En esta función tendrás que: En el área de Banca & Seguros estamos buscando un/a Desarrollador de Software tendrá como funciones: Descriptor del cargo programar la solución de software de acuerdo a las normas y herramientas de la empresa, con el fin de cumplir los estándares de calidad definidos en el acuerdo previo de nivel de atención al cliente, garantizando un servicio de excelencia Ejecutar funciones de acuerdo al software proporcionado con las especificaciones de diseño. Analizar los requisitos del sistema y los procesos de negocio existentes y sistemas de información Construir y ejecutar pruebas unitarias y planes de pruebas unitarias. En algunos casos contribuyen en la elaboración la arquitectura técnica de la solución Asegurar el cumplimiento de normas de calidad. Proponer mejoras en el servicio. Mantener informados e Jefe de Área y clientes sobre avances y resultados Ideal si cuentas con: Conocimiento NET Framework, Base de datos MS SQL SERVER, React, GIT, Lenguajes: VB.Net, C#.T-SQL, JavaScript. Habilidades: Análisis, diseño y construcción. Debe contar con: Estudios Técnicos Nivel Superior (Título relacionado al rubro de TI) Ingeniería informática. Desde 2 años de experiencia laboral ¿Qué puedes esperar de nosotros? Flexibilidad laboral, promoviendo el equilibrio en tu vida personal y profesional. Desarrollo profesional y evolución constante de tus habilidades, siempre según tus intereses. Un ambiente colaborativo, diverso e innovador, que fomenta el trabajo en equipo. ¿Qué ofrecemos? SONDA Academy, una plataforma educativa de aprendizaje constante que busca potenciar al máximo tu desarrollo profesional. Trabajo híbrido, en SONDA sabemos que la flexibilidad es importante para tu bienestar es por eso que contamos con jornadas presenciales y de teletrabajo. SONDA Wellness, un programa que busca apoyarte en el balance de tu vida personal y profesional, que promoviendo una serie de iniciativas enfocadas en tu salud física, mental y social. Y mucho más! Diversidad +Inclusión = Innovación y colaboración En SONDA estamos comprometidos con la diversidad. Fomentamos un ambiente inclusivo que garantice que los talentos puedan trabajar en un entorno positivo que los invite a desarrollar su carrera profesional en igualdad de oportunidades. Porque sabemos que un ambiente diverso es un elemento fundamental para impulsar la innovación, buscamos candidatos en función de su cualificación profesional, independientemente de su raza, color de piel, religión, edad, sexo, orientación sexual, identidad de género, nacionalidad o discapacidad. ¡Sé parte de nuestro equipo!

Title: Senior Big Data Engineer
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Description EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential. Senior Big Data engineers   are responsible for designing and implementing large-scale data processing systems. They’re often tasked with building new applications or improving existing ones, all while ensuring that they meet the needs of their company’s business objectives. In this role you must be able to work independently projects. You may also need to interact with other teams within their organization to ensure that their product meets the needs of everyone involved. #REF_HOU_CO   Responsibilities Work with the team to build a streaming platform from scratch Create and maintain data pipelines and warehouses systems to power the best user experience through effective data processing Work on building out the core backend services used to support the Hulu experience Contribute to the design, architecture, and development of critical backend services Build highly scalable and available systems that are well tested and maintainable Collaborate with other team members to achieve product and business requirements Experiment with new technologies to make sure we can scale for the future Requirements 3+ years of experience Strong background and experience with streaming and big data tools and technologies such as PySpark, Flink, Samza, Hadoop, Storm and Kafka Streams Experience with data model design and data warehouse Strong experience with a Programming Language: Python OR Scala OR Java OR Kotlin Experience with any Cloud provider (AWS, CGP or Azure) Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases Extensive experience building highly scalable, reliable and maintainable services Extensive experience working with large scale distributed data processing Excellent English communication skills and problem-solving approach Nice to have Experience with Messaging brokers such as Kinesis, Kafka, Pub/Sub, Azure Events Hub, and so on Benefits Improved medical coverage - EPAMers are eligible to participate in a supplementary health insurance program that shall have the usual coverage in the industry, with the Company funding 100% of the value of the monthly premium for participation Lunch Allowance - You will receive a daily allowance of CLP $ 7.000 per working day. Enjoy a nice meal on us Allowance for internet and electricity - You will receive an allowance of CLP$15.000 per month to cover internet and electricity expenses National Holiday Bonus - We celebrate joining the Chilean Market. That is why all our employees will receive a bonus of CLP $86,646 in September Christmas Bonus - You will receive an End of Year bonus of CLP $170,539. It will be paid during the month of December, to ensure you have a Happy Holiday! Learning Culture - We want you to be the best version of yourself, that is why we offer unlimited access to learning platforms, a wide range of internal courses, and all the knowledge you need to grow professionally Additional Income - Besides your regular salary, you will also have the chance to earn extra income by referring talent, being a technical interviewer, and many more ways Are you open to relocation? - If you want to relocate to another country and we have the right project, we will assist you every step of the way, to help you and your family, reach your new home We offer We trust our people. We believe in team distribution and that you know what you are doing, which is why you will be able to work remotely and have a flexible schedule We are both proud of working within a diverse and inclusive environment and acting in our role as an equal opportunities’ employer. You are welcome at EPAM for who you are You will be challenged while working side-by side with the best talent globally. We work with top-notch technologies, constantly seeking out new industry trends and best practices We are a global design community eager to share knowledge, experiences, and mentoring. You will learn, contribute, and grow with us How does it sound to know you can have a 20+year career with us constantly growing and without the need to look elsewhere? We offer access to learning platforms, classes, and workshops to support your development. You will be set up for success with our clear career paths and support in helping you achieve the goals you set for yourself, both personal and professional We seek improvement in a proactive manner. You have the freedom to make recommendations, suggestions or simply comment on things without the pressure of adhering to hierarchy or strict processes We work with a broad range of clients: Media, Entertainment, Life Sciences, Automotive, Finance, Technology, and Travel. You will play a key role in growing their business and potentially work in multiple new industries   Apply

Title: Senior .NET Developer (Full Stack)
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Are you a tech professional looking for remote work in a global setting? If yes, this job is for you. Welcome to EPAM Anywhere - a global job platform offering remote work opportunities in the technology sector. Join us to build a career around your lifestyle working on modern projects for global brands and exciting startups.  We are looking for an experienced  Senior .NET Developer (Full Stack)  to join our team  remotely . As a Senior .NET Developer, you will be responsible for analysis, design, and implementation of assigned development tasks. You will work on the platform backend development, component design, implementation, and delivery. Moreover, you will be accountable for owning the technical solutions and mitigating technical risks. Responsibilities Provide estimates with documented assumptions, considerations, and dependencies  Identify and address system issues, bugs, and bottlenecks  Work on improving system scalability, stability, and performance  Develop applications and tools from scratch  Participate in improving the overall application architecture  Requirements 3+ years of experience as a Full Stack Developer  Proficient in .NET/C# development and React JS, TypeScript, and Angular 2+  Expertise in developing Web API, ASP.NET MVC, .Net Core, Bootstrap, and jQuery  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with proficiency in NoSQL databases particularly in MongoDB Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously B2+ English level Nice to have Past experience working with automated jobs/payment processing  Knowledge of CI/CD tooling and containerization  Familiarity with Scrum/Agile methodologies We offer Paid time off Paid sick leave days Medical insurance Stable income Lunch allowance Bonuses for holidays celebration Remote-forever work Free licensed software Stable workload Relocation opportunities Flexible engagement models Free trainings for technical and soft skills Free access to LinkedIn Learning platform Language courses Free access to internal and external e-Libraries Certification opportunities Skill advisory service This is a remote position and we welcome applications from anywhere in Chile Once you apply, you'll receive a confirmation email with a link to EPAM Anywhere platform. Sign up with this link to automate your prescreening, be able to monitor your application statuses, and enjoy a faster job application process. We accept CVs only in  English . Please note that even though you are applying for this position, you may be offered other projects to join within EPAM Anywhere. EPAM Anywhere is a part of EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM). Since 1993, EPAM has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider.

Title: Full Stack JavaScript - Docente
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Company Description: Desafío Latam Job Description: ¿Imaginas construir el futuro de Latinoamérica además del tuyo? En Desafío Latam impactamos el desarrollo de nuestra región a través de la formación de personas en tecnología, generando una transformación profesional efectiva y en poco tiempo. Abrimos el camino para que las personas interesadas en programación se desarrollen y trabajen donde amen hacerlo. Por eso buscamos talentos capaces de inspirar y transformar carreras profesionales a través de la educación, para sumarse a nuestro equipo docente. Full Stack JavaScript es un programa de 48 semanas que inicia a los participantes en un camino profesional en el desarrollo de aplicaciones web utilizando el entorno Node.js. Desarrollan varios desafíos prácticos para generar experiencia y portafolio, hasta lograr construir aplicaciones de manera independiente. Conoce más sobre la carrera en: www.desafiolatam.com Cada semana los estudiantes tendrán 2 sesiones: 1 clase con él o la docente y 1 taller con su tutor(a) asignado(a), quien los apoyará en el desarrollo del desafío semanal. Algunas de tus responsabilidades como Docente: Deberás impartir 1 clase a la semana, de 2 horas cronológicas. Coordinarte semanalmente con tu(s) tutor(as), para sugerir focos en el taller según las necesidades que identificaste durante tus clases. Corregir la prueba final de cada módulo (8 en total). Antes de tu primera clase deberás pasar por nuestra capacitación docente. Siempre tener como prioridad la experiencia de tus estudiantes. Busca que disfruten tu clase y se mantengan motivados, factores clave para que completen sus estudios y logren transformar su carrera profesional. Conocimientos necesarios: Construcción web HTML y CSS, control de versiones Git y GitHub. CSS avanzado, Flexbox, Grid, Media Queries, Sass Programación avanzada en Javascript Desarrollo Backend en Node JS Bases de datos con Node JS y Express JS Framework Express JS React, consumo de APIs con React React Router, Context Requisitos: Experiencia laboral de mínimo 2 años en los sectores de desarrollo web, HTML, CSS y JavaScript y desarrollo de aplicaciones web utilizando React JS. Contar con un título técnico de nivel superior en el área de las Ingenierías y/o Informática. Si no tienes un título, deberás demostrar una experiencia práctica destacada de al menos 5 años. Deseable: experiencia cómo docente en instituciones de educación superior y/o como facilitador(a) de capacitación para personas adultas. Horarios: Vespertino: Lunes o Martes o Miércoles o Jueves de 19.00 a 21.00 hrs. (hora chilena). Algunos de nuestros beneficios: Pasarás por un proceso de capacitación docente antes de tu primera clase, donde te entregaremos las herramientas metodológicas que necesitas para lograr una buena experiencia en el aula. Además durante la ejecución de tu curso recibirás retroalimentación y soporte de nuestro equipo, para desarrollar y potenciar tus habilidades docentes. Te entregaremos todos los contenidos y presentaciones para cada clase. Tú sólo debes preocuparte de preparar cada una y complementar con tu propia experiencia. Trabajo 100% Remoto. Haz clases desde cualquier parte del mundo. Podrás acceder a descuentos en carreras, cursos y talleres de Desafío Latam. Cada vez que termines una generación podrás acceder a una nueva, lo que te dará continuidad en Desafío Latam. ¡Acepta el desafío y únete a nuestra comunidad de cracks docentes!

Title: Senior Data Engineer - Internationally-Based Applicants
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: About Toptal Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company. We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold. Position Description This is a remote position. At Toptal, we measure everything and always rely on data to guide all of our initiatives, including both our long-term strategy and our day-to-day operations. As a Senior Data Engineer, your main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts. You will support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation, creativity, and solutions that will have a significant impact on our velocity. We, in turn, will give you autonomy and freedom to turn your ideas into reality. We are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English. Responsibilities: Build scalable, highly performant infrastructure for delivering clear business insights from a variety of raw data sources.  Develop batch & real-time analytical solutions, prototypes, and proofs of concept for selected solutions.  Build frameworks and tools to empower our data scientists and analysts.  Implement complex analytical projects with a focus on collecting, managing, analyzing, and visualizing data.  Be in constant communication with team members and other relevant parties and convey results efficiently and clearly.  In the first week, expect to: Meet mentors that will help you during your onboarding month.  Start participating in company-wide training sessions.  Setup your local environment and become familiar with our tech stack.  In the first month, expect to: Build your first Pull Request and have it deployed to production.  Learn about the technology that powers Toptal - the services, patterns, and libraries we use and develop.  Have a good understanding of Toptal’s business.  Develop a deeper understanding of our technology, processes, and product pipeline.  In the first three months, expect to: Have strong knowledge of Toptal’s business.  Actively supply software planning, development, and maintenance.  Be ready to propose and implement improvements to Toptal’s processes and codebase.  Deliver value in a regular cadence.  Get comfortable in your daily work within your team.  In the first six months, expect to: Lead technical initiatives on our team.  Drive improvements to the codebase and processes.  Contribute to planning and executing multi-sprint initiatives inside your team.  Be able to not only solve complex problems, but also consider multiple solutions, weigh them and decide on the best course of action.  Proactively identify technical debt and product areas that require attention or improvements and suggest improvements in our technology stack.  In the first year, expect to: Have a detailed understanding of Toptal’s business, collaboration rituals, processes, performance, and future work.  Determine what your career path looks like at Toptal.  Mentor Toptal’s new team members.  Meet your team in person during an off-site.  Give and receive 360 feedback in a yearly review cycle.  Requirements: Working experience with Python and Pandas.  Experience with SQL.  Familiarity with the basic principles of distributed computing and data modeling.  Extensive experience with object-oriented design and coding and testing patterns, including experience with engineering software platforms and data infrastructures.  Working experience with Airflow and Luigi is a big plus.  Working experience with Scala is a plus.  Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (e.g. GCS and BigQuery) is a plus.  Working experience with Dimensional Modeling.  Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.  Be excited about collaborating daily with your team and other groups while working via a distributed model.  Be eager to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.  Be open to receiving constructive feedback.  You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.  For Toptal Use Only: #southamerica #easterneurope #individualcontributoreurope

Title: Senior Software Engineer, Product
Ciudad: Área metropolitana de Santiago
Descripcion: Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.  Mission  Finances are one of the major sources of stress in American households, and nine out of ten Americans say nothing would make them feel more confident than having their personal finances in order. We are building the most comprehensive personal finance platform to help people improve their financial lives and achieve their goals. From Our Client The Company Our company came out of private beta in early 2021. Since that time we have quickly became one of the premier ways to manage your financial life. Customers love the product and we have seen rapid, organic growth. Our users say that we help them feel more confident in their finances, and more confident in their financial future. Our founding team consists of product-driven, serial entrepreneurs with multiple exits. Additionally, our CEO was one of the original creators of Mint.com and has a unique perspective on what is needed to meet consumers' needs in this market. We are passionate about building a company, product and brand that both customers and employees love. We are well-funded by top venture firms and angel investors. We founded the company as a fully-remote team (pre Covid!) and are open to applicants that live within a 5 hour time zone difference of US Pacific Time.  Your Contribution   As one of our first full-stack engineers, you will play a critical role in growing and evolving our web and mobile app.   You will be more than just a software craftsperson; you will also be a thought partner in building a product, company, and culture we are proud of.   You will have significant input into the processes, rituals, and tools we use in order to create a high performing engineering team.   You will typically work with a lot of autonomy, and be expected to "own" the full implementation of whatever you work on.  Skills  You consider yourself a "product-centric" engineer and take pride in building something people love. You are opinionated about the user experience.   You enjoy and strive when given autonomy and independence, and are comfortable with ambiguity and simplifying complex problems.   You have 3+ years experience in full-stack development with some combination of Python, Django, React, React Native, iOS and Android development.   You have superb written and verbal communication skills.   You are familiar with best practices in engineering, architecture, security, and design for both web and mobile apps, and can help build scalable, fault-tolerant products.   You have (or want) experience with early-stage company best practices including rapid iteration with robust metrics and qualitative user feedback. Title: Senior DevOps CI/CD Engineer
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Description In this role, you’ll ensure that proper CI/CD and DevOps Practices are executed in order to guaranteed that our client’s AWS Infrastructure performs at the highest level, stays fully updated and secure and can scale in case there’s an increase or decrease in their needs, either by creating new Cloud environments or my improving current existing resources Req. 306898484 What You Have Good written and oral communication skills, experience in technical writing and documenting Experience with implementing CI/CD pipelines (AWS) Solid understanding of Software Development Life Cycle, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery Solid understanding and experience working with high availability, high performance, multi-data center systems and hybrid cloud environments Experience with version control systems such as Git Experience with Jenkins, Groovy, Artifactory, Terraform, Ansible, PowerShell/Python Experience with any cloud technologies Good English communication skills (speaking, writing and reading) Ability to work independently under general direction Strong understanding of mobile and web backend infrastructure technologies Expert understanding of distributed systems design and implementation Experience with enterprise integration patterns Experience with CI/CD Pipeline Development and maintenance A strong preference for test-driven development Excellent communication and priority management skills in an agile environment Responsibilities Lead, advocate and enforce solid CI/CD best DevOps practices Collaborate with development teams, ensuring they follow DevOps procedures and best practices Manage change control process. Manage production backups, sandbox refreshes and continuously improve release processes Implement infrastructure-as-code principles on at least one of the major IaaS providers Provide support for a development team from Ops perspective Configure Secure Continuous Integration and Delivery pipelines Configure new and already existing environments Configure management and automation of systems maintenance Participate in discussions, influences outcomes, and makes recommendations on feasibility and processes and architecture Devise/modify procedures to solve problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and desired results Create and maintain a cross-region multi-cluster Kubernetes architecture Leverage istio to mesh services together Maintain an AWS WorkSpaces infrastructure supporting our back office Model, build, and maintain infrastructure using Terraform on AWS Build, maintain, and deploy software artifacts as Docker images and containers Support our CI/CD pipelines used by Product and Release Engineering Support various teams with a high level of dedication and professionalism Build, maintain, and support InfoSec solutions based upon industry best practices Benefits Improved medical coverage -EPAMers are eligible to participate in a supplementary health insurance program that shall have the usual coverage in the industry, with the Company funding 100% of the value of the monthly premium for participation Allowance for internet and electricity -You will receive an allowance of CLP$15.000 per month to cover internet and electricity expenses Lunch Allowance -you will receive a daily allowance of CLP $ 7.000 per working day. Enjoy a nice meal on us National Holiday Bonus -We celebrate joining the Chilean Market. That’s why all our employees will receive a bonus of CLP $86,646 in September Christmas Bonus -You’ll receive an End of the Year bonus of CLP $170,539. It’ll be paid during the month of December, to ensure you have Happy Holidays! Learning Culture - We want you to be the best version of yourself, that is why we offer unlimited access to learning platforms, a wide range of internal courses, and all the knowledge you need to grow professionally Professional Growth Opportunities - We have designed a highly competitive and complete development process, where you will have all the tools to get where you have always wanted to be, personally and professionally Additional Income - Besides your regular salary, you will also have the chance to earn extra income by referring talent, being a technical interviewer, and many more ways Community Benefit - You will be part of a worldwide community of over 50,000 employees, where you can learn, challenge yourself, stand out, and share your knowledge and experience with multicultural teams! Are you open to relocation? - If you want to relocate to another country and we have the right project, we will assist you every step of the way, to help you and your family, reach your new home We offer We trust our people. We believe in team distribution and that you know what you are doing, which is why you will be able to work remotely and have a flexible schedule.   We are both proud of working within a diverse and inclusive environment and acting in our role as an equal opportunities’ employer. You are welcome at EPAM for who you are.   You will be challenged while working side-by side with the best talent globally. We work with top-notch technologies, constantly seeking out new industry trends and best practices.   We are a global design community eager to share knowledge, experiences, and mentoring. You will learn, contribute, and grow with us How does it sound to know you can have a 20+year career with us constantly growing and without the need to look elsewhere? We offer access to learning platforms, classes, and workshops to support your development. You will be set up for success with our clear career paths and support in helping you achieve the goals you set for yourself, both personal and professional   We seek improvement in a proactive manner. You have the freedom to make recommendations, suggestions or simply comment on things without the pressure of adhering to hierarchy or strict processes We work with a broad range of clients: Media, Entertainment, Life Sciences, Automotive, Finance, Technology, and Travel. You will play a key role in growing their business and potentially work in multiple new industries.   About EPAM EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential   Apply

Title: Senior Software Engineer, Product
Ciudad: Área metropolitana de Santiago
Descripcion: Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.  Mission  Finances are one of the major sources of stress in American households, and nine out of ten Americans say nothing would make them feel more confident than having their personal finances in order. We are building the most comprehensive personal finance platform to help people improve their financial lives and achieve their goals. From Our Client The Company Our company came out of private beta in early 2021. Since that time we have quickly became one of the premier ways to manage your financial life. Customers love the product and we have seen rapid, organic growth. Our users say that we help them feel more confident in their finances, and more confident in their financial future. Our founding team consists of product-driven, serial entrepreneurs with multiple exits. Additionally, our CEO was one of the original creators of Mint.com and has a unique perspective on what is needed to meet consumers' needs in this market. We are passionate about building a company, product and brand that both customers and employees love. We are well-funded by top venture firms and angel investors. We founded the company as a fully-remote team (pre Covid!) and are open to applicants that live within a 5 hour time zone difference of US Pacific Time.  Your Contribution   As one of our first full-stack engineers, you will play a critical role in growing and evolving our web and mobile app.   You will be more than just a software craftsperson; you will also be a thought partner in building a product, company, and culture we are proud of.   You will have significant input into the processes, rituals, and tools we use in order to create a high performing engineering team.   You will typically work with a lot of autonomy, and be expected to "own" the full implementation of whatever you work on.  Skills  You consider yourself a "product-centric" engineer and take pride in building something people love. You are opinionated about the user experience.   You enjoy and strive when given autonomy and independence, and are comfortable with ambiguity and simplifying complex problems.   You have 3+ years experience in full-stack development with some combination of Python, Django, React, React Native, iOS and Android development.   You have superb written and verbal communication skills.   You are familiar with best practices in engineering, architecture, security, and design for both web and mobile apps, and can help build scalable, fault-tolerant products.   You have (or want) experience with early-stage company best practices including rapid iteration with robust metrics and qualitative user feedback.   Nice to have: Experience building APIs with Django Rest Framework   Nice to have: Experience working in a financial technology company (accounting, investing, banking, etc)   Nice to have: Experience working in a remote-first culture  Benefits  Work wherever you want! As a fully remote company with no central office, we want you to work wherever you are happiest and most productive. Whether that’s out of your home, a co-working space, or elsewhere.   Competitive cash and equity compensation in a hyper growth, early stage company 🚀.   Stipend to set-up your ideal working environment.   Medical, dental and vision benefits (Full time US only).   401k (US only).   Unlimited PTO.   3 day weekend every month! We take off the “First Friday” every month to focus on rest, recuperation, or just having fun!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Salary Range: $150,000-$200,000 base.

Title: (Aerolinea) Arquitecto de Software
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Acid Labs  es una firma de diseño y desarrollo de software end to end. Ejecutamos un proceso ágil estandarizado pero flexible, centrado en la calidad y la comunicación. Nos centramos en la creación de productos web y móviles increíbles, hemos estado involucrados en el desarrollo web y móvil desde 2006, convirtiéndonos en socios sólidos para nuestros clientes . Nos especializamos en crear nuevos productos a partir de un proceso UX / UI, desarrollando proyectos desde cero y también sobre proyectos ya creados, trabajando solo o como equipo para mejorías. Somos expertos en software de venta minorista, comercio electrónico a medida y empresarial, aprovechamos las configuraciones de CRM y escalamos las ventas a través del diseño y la tecnología. ¡Nos encontramos en búsqueda de Arquitecto de Software!   Área:  Arquitectura de Software Funciones:  Es proyecto es para migración de plataforma de integración(TIBCO), es un producto tiene un bus de integración, mensajería y diseño estilo bpmn, es muy particular, por lo mismo será liderado por arquitectos latam. Experiencia trabajando con Metodologías de desarrollo Cascadas y Ágil Conocimientos comprobables en: Cloud, con preferencia en GCP,  deben tener sólidos conocimientos de Front y Back Stack:  java, spring boot, bd relacionales, microservicios Jenkins, Kubernetes  También capacidad de realizar diseños y explicarlos  Ideal que sea un arquitecto de software con conocimiento de Cloud  Metodología ágiles

Title: Senior Frontend Engineer at Early Stage Startup
Ciudad: Área metropolitana de Santiago
Descripcion: Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.  Our Client  Our client is reimagining the web as we know it. Our client's mission is to empower every person to be a creator. And as a result, maximize human potential. They are seeking a Senior Frontend Engineer to help create a new way of building on the web. Come help us expand our MVP into a public utility that empowers hundreds of millions of users More about our Client Our client is a cross between a web page builder and a social media platform. The result will be an explosion of creativity and content. You care more about user satisfaction than a perfect technical design   Ability to prototype new concepts quickly and iterate for rapid feedback   Well-versed in Typescript, React, HTML5 and CSS3   Passionate about our client's mission to empower every person to be a creator and unleash the potential of humankind   Base Salary Range:   $130-170K

Title: Embedded Linux Containers Software Engineer
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Work on mission-critical Golang code, focused on software delivery, containers, security sandboxing, telemetry and device management, as a software engineer on our SnapD team. Snaps are next-generation software packaging and delivery for Linux. They are designed for safety, security and robustness, with application-specific confinement of containers optimised for IoT devices, desktops and servers. Our goal is that snaps work across multiple Linux flavors to ensure that publishers have the simplest way to reach the whole Linux world. This role requires an obsession with quality and performance, for work at the heart of the operating system. It also requires an interest in the software publishing and consumption experience. Applicants should be passionate about open source software development. We value collaboration, peer reviews, good unit/integration testing and maintainable code. General knowledge and experience with Golang and Linux as a developer platform is required. What you'll do Collaborate proactively with a distributed team Write high quality code to create new features Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them Review code produced by other engineers Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions Obsess over how to achieve robustness despite unexpected events like power outages Work from home with global travel for up to two weeks, twice a year Who you are You love technology and working with brilliant people You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable You value soft skills, are thoughtful and self-motivated You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You have professional software development experience using Go, Python, C, or C++ You know Linux system-level fundamentals, e.g. cgroups, namespaces, apparmor Commitment to software testing, code reviews and maintainable code About Canonical Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace. Work from home Learning and development allowances Competitive Salary Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Generous annual leave Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave Priority Pass for travel Exposure to international business and technology We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Analista de planificación y datos
Ciudad: Área metropolitana de Santiago
Descripcion: Acerca del área Planificación y Análisis financiero es un área encargada de ayudar a la organización a planear, pronosticar y presupuestar con precisión, para respaldar las principales decisiones empresariales de la compañía. En nuestra empresa estamos buscando un Analista de Planificación y Datos apasionado por la resolución y el análisis de datos. ¿Qué esperamos del Analista de Planificación y Datos? Participar en la definición de los objetivos de la empresa y desarrollar planes de acción para su cumplimiento. Identificar áreas de mejora y oportunidades de crecimiento en el negocio a través del análisis de datos y la generación de informes.  Evaluar el rendimiento de la empresa y sus unidades de negocio a través del análisis de los indicadores claves de desempeño. Desarrollar modelos financieros, de presupuesto , realizar pronósticos y proyecciones financieras para la toma de decisiones.  Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de finanzas para garantizas la precisión y consistencia de los informes financieros. Identificar y analizar tendencias y patrones de datos para informar sobre los cambios en el mercado y las necesidades del cliente. Ayudar en la identificación de oportunidades de reducción de costos y mejorar la eficiencia en los procesos. Participar en proyectos estratégicos y colaborar con otros equipos para lograr los objetivos organizaciones. Recopilar, analizar y presentar datos para identificar oportunidades de mejora y hacer recomendaciones para la toma de decisiones. Desarrollar y mantener modelos de planificación y pronósticos de ventas, costos y otros indicadores clave de rendimiento. Trabajar con herramientas de análisis de datos y software para extraer información y generar informes de análisis. Identificar áreas de mejora y trabajar en la implementación de soluciones a través de la automatización de procesos y la mejora de la eficiencia.  Aportar con su experiencia y conocimientos en la mejora de procesos del área, data analytics y contabilidad Ser un agente de cambio e impulsar el proceso de transformación digital desde el corazón de la operación Principales funciones. Liderar la implementación de nuevas herramientas de reportería, sistemas financieros y análisis de datos Preparar forecasts y proyecciones de indicadores financieros clave con una mirada predictiva  Capacidad de análisis – trabaja eficientemente con grandes volúmenes de datos, sintetizando, administrando base de datos y obteniendo insights de alto valor con data íntegra  Requisitos Ingeniero Comercial, Ingeniero Industrial o Ingeniero en informática.  Haber participado en iniciativas de control presupuestario.  Excel avanzado. Modelamiento de datos. ETL. Python (Deseable). Azure Cloud. Estadística. Análisis Financiero.  Conocimientos en SQL Conocimientos en Azure Conocimientos en PowerBI (Deseable)  Beneficios Modalidad híbrida. Seguro complementario de Salud. Beneficios corporativos de balance de vida y bienestar integral. Jornada laboral de 40 horas. Programas constantes de entrenamiento y acompañamiento. Servipag es una empresa líder en el mercado de las transacciones, pagos y recaudaciones, que fue creada en 1990 por dos de las principales instituciones financieras del país, BCI y Banco de Chile, como una sociedad orientada al apoyo del giro bancario nacional. Si te apasiona entregar día a día altos estándares, logrando experiencias superiores de servicio, entonces ¡postula con nosotros! Hoy nos encontramos en la búsqueda de nuestro nuev@ Analista de planificación y datos quien tendrá el desafío de;

Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer (Remote)
Ciudad: Chile
Descripcion: Are you a highly-skilled, creative, and visionary SRE who is excited to embrace new challenges, achieve technical excellence, and make an impact in the international IT industry? ioet, Inc is a software engineering company, we are proud of our passionate, forward-thinking, and mission-driven LATAM software development team. Together, we provide innovative solutions services to our fast-moving clients, from start-ups as well as some of the world’s most famous brands, helping them to make an impact in their industries. If you are looking to refine your technical skills, use your talent to the fullest, and build an exciting career, ioet it is the place for you! Requirements: Containers (Docker and Docker-compose are required. Extra points if you know other tools like LXC/LXD, runc, containers, etc.). RancherOS is a plus. At least one container orchestrator (e.g., Kubernetes, Nomad, Swarm, Fleet, etc.). Experience with a service mesh like Istio. Experience setting up CI/CD pipelines. (e.g., Jenkins, Flux CD for Kubernetes). At least one cloud vendor. (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP, OpenStack, Bluemix, etc.). At least one RDBMS server (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server, etc.). Experience with at least one provisioning and configuration tool: Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Terraform, CloudFormation, cloud-init, etc. Scripting skills: Python, Bash, PowerShell, Ruby, etc. Ability to learn new topics through independent research as well as collaborative knowledge sharing. Advanced English skills (written and spoken). Time zone +/- 4 hours from Quito, Ecuador. Enjoy ioet's benefits: ioet prioritizes the work-life balance of our team, we are excited to extend the following benefits to our software developer team. You can work remotely or from one of our awesome offices in Ecuador (Quito, Loja, Guayaquil) Flexible schedule Work with international clients Paid in USD Paid Holidays Paid Vacation Paid sick days Paid family leave English classes Annual bonus Educational bonus Career plan with regular salary revisions Focus on personal growth and helping others grow Are you ready to experience ioet? Have ready your  CV and Cover Letter in English  and Apply Now at www.ioet.com

Title: Senior Software Engineer, Product
Ciudad: Área metropolitana de Santiago
Descripcion: Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more. If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.  Our Client's Mission  Reduce inequity by helping immigrants move money home by becoming the leading cross-border fintech for immigrants.  The Role  We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our small but growing engineering team to define, build and iterate on features for our consumer-facing product! You will work closely with Product, Operations, Customer Support, Growth and other functions to design and build a reliable, intuitive, and simple experience for our users. As an early member of the team, we hope you will also have a lot of impact on our team culture, processes and norms. Our client is a cross-platform mobile app developed with React Native and TypeScript, which talks to a backend service written in Kotlin and backed by a PostgreSQL database, all of which runs on AWS and is managed via Terraform and Ansible. This is a full-stack role, and you will have plenty of opportunities to work on all parts of our tech stack. We’re an encouraging environment that values both teamwork and autonomy, and have many exciting upcoming challenges, including scaling up to handle increased volume and complexity, improving UI and UX to drive growth and retention, building internal tools for our customer support and acquisition efforts, and much more!    You are:     Looking to join a growing team and collaborate on product decisions   Great at balancing speed of execution with writing clean, well-designed code   Looking to be a part of an inclusive culture where everyone brings their whole selves to work   A clear communicator who believes in communicating kindly but candidly   Committed to using your engineering skills for social good       Requirements:     3+ years of full-time software development experience, or equivalent   Proficiency with React or React Native, and a typed backend language like Java or Kotlin   Experience owning user-facing features end-to-end, from conception to launch   Experience developing software in a collaborative, multi-functional, and fast-paced environment       Nice to have but not required:     Experience with TypeScript   Experience working on a multi-platform mobile app with a significant volume of traffic   Experience creating design mocks or other kinds of UX work   Experience working on systems that have real-world performance and reliability constraints       Benefits (US)- specifics depend on geography!     Competitive salary (based on experience)   Medical, vision, and dental insurance   Unlimited leave   Flexible hours   Regular team events   Professional development opportunities (e.g. language lessons, training, etc.)   Equipment (laptop, accessories)   Work from home desk stipend   Behavioral health benefits  Benefits:  PTO, Health Benefits, and More!  Base Salary Range:   $140-170K

Title: .Net/C# Engineer - Remote Work
Ciudad: Gran Santiago, Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile
Descripcion: Be part of our team! 🚀💼 Are you ready to launch your career into the tech stratosphere with one of LatAm's fastest-growing software development companies? 💪💻 At Oowlish, we're on the hunt for tech maestros to join our dynamic, cosmopolitan squad. As an 🦉Oowlish🦉 team member, you won’t just be part of a team, you’ll join an innovative, supportive family, partnering with top-tier clients from the USA and Europe 🌍 to kickstart their digital journey. And being part of a 🌟Great Place to Work🌟, it’s all about learning, growing, and making a global impact - together! Enjoy the flexibility of working in your PJs 🧦, with your furry friend 🐶 on your lap, relishing your freedom and maintaining a perfect work-family life balance ⚖️. Because we know that’s when you’re at your best. If you're a tech enthusiast 🕹️, fluent in English 🗣️, and thrilled about working remotely while making an international splash, then you're on the right page! Responsabilities Work on multiple teams to architect, build, deploy, maintain, and improve software applications for the client Deal with a wide variety of frameworks and projects. Some of our clients are launching their first mobile product, others need support on existing complex applications, and others we work alongside an existing engineering team in co-development. Architect APIs, and complex business logic, build beautiful frontends, and implement 3rd party integrations working alongside other curious engineers and team members. Share responsibility for reviewing pull requests to ensure code quality and applications are maintainable and scalable. Train and mentor junior engineers in their development growth. Collaborate with designers and product managers on the implementation of requirements and client specifications. Write automated tests. Contribute to client´s growing internal Best Practices and Product Engineering Methodology documentation. Must Haves Ability to effectively communicate via written and spoken English. 7+ years of software development experience. 4+ years of experience working in C#, ASP.NET, .NET Core, and Git An understanding of software development best practices and a commitment to following them. Comfort in reviewing others’ code and providing meaningful and clear feedback to overall improve a code base. Comfort with paired programming and teaching other engineers about best practices, solutions, and implementation. Ability to work 40 hours per week. Nice To Have Experience working in TFS Benefits & Perks  Home office 🏠  Flexible Hours;🕜  Competitive compensation based on experience; 💵  Career plans to allow for extensive growth in the company;📈  International Projects;🌍  Oowlish English Program (Improving and Certifying)📚  Spanish Classes 📚  Oowlish fitness with Total Pass;🏋‍♀️  Oowlish Academy (Grants for Education);🎓  Build your Home Office (Grants for Computer & Equipment);💻  Connecting You (Internet allowance);📡  Anniversary bonus;💸  Wedding gift;👰‍♀️  Pet adoption incentive;🐕  New baby Owl bonus;👩‍🍼  Back to School bonus;✏️  Netflix Subscription;📽  Oowlish paradise – 4 days/year at a Resort with your family & pets;🏝  Vacation Bonus;🏖  Games and Competitions;🎮  Enjoy your national Holidays;🎊  Oowlet Store🛒 Come join us in breaking the mold and revolutionizing the tech landscape! 🌐 Remember, with Oowlish, you’re not just getting a job, you’re becoming part of a community 🌍 of innovative, talented, and inspiring individuals who respect each other and our furry friends 🐾.
